Reviews.Title: “show weekend”
Reviews.Author: ellisjon
Reviews.Content: hotel is a little warn around edges, room was ok bed quite comfortable had dbl room on rear of hotel 2nd floor alot of early noise from laundry down below,but room was adiquate and clean, breakfast ,i have had better, although english breakfast was offered it could have been hotter. staff on front desk were very nice as were porters and bar staff no complaints.would stay there again if visiting london was not to far from most places to visit .

Reviews.Title: “could do better”
Reviews.Author: Champ57
Reviews.Content: Stayed begining of March for two nights. Pleasant reception staff. Room ok. Front of the hotel on third floor. No problem with traffic noise. a good lick of paint would not go amiss.Bed not the comfiest I've slept on. Housekeepers made quite a racket as they went about their business.No chance of a lie in. Had evening meal on first night..a carvery. Decent enough for standard of hotel. However breakfast was a let down. It was the usual english breakfast.. buffett style. Not sure how long the food had been kept in the food warmers. Tea as has been mentioned in other reviews was not worth drinking. Why? Because it came out of an urn so has been stewing rather than brewing for I don't know how long. Also we were given a table where the tablecoth was stained from the previous occupants and were also sat directly in line of the air conditioning so breakfast went cold rather quickly. These problems could be sorted with a little more attention to detail which comes down to staff training and therefor management. Overall could do better.

Reviews.Title: “If you are in a Tour Group fine, otherwise avoid it”
Reviews.Author: HeHooTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night after coming for a lecture - the internet connection in room was awful and the staff kept on saying it will work. In the lobby worked on one side only. Rooms small and beds smaller. Double bed is large enough only for one; take a single if you are only one and that will decrease the cost. Nice pubs in the area, Russell Sq Tube Station very very close. As on Picadilly Line it is one run from Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied customer Dave Pike”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: just got home from our third stay at the president always happy with the room and breakfast , will certainly use them again. just hope they will ring local council and complain about loose manhole covers in road outside, very noisy this time

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and UK locals stay here as well.”
Reviews.Author: Coolmango
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and basic. The Bed was not all that comfortable to be honest. We wanted to change rooms, but the place is so busy, it was nearly impossible. The place is massive, built in the 80's by the look of it, it could use some TLC, but it is in authentic good condition. Everything works, but so very old. The thing I noticed was that many locals stay there. For weekends, or "as required". The staff are multicultural. No problem with that at all, but it can be a surprise. The bar is "sports" themed, and is Old English bar look. The restaurant is huge. I must say the food was plentiful, but pretty average. We were there for 5 nights, and eating out would be something I would encourage, as there is plenty of good pubs and eateries around. But value, comfort and amenities were good. It is exactly how it presents itself. It is "middle of the road". It has everything you could possibly need. Location is central, close to transport. Oh - the Key ! it is a real key and it is on like a "Harry Potter wand". leave it at the lobby when you go out for te day....

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey B
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed here for 2 nights as we had tickets for The Lion King (FANTASTIC show). Staff were always there if needed, 3 Stars. The food was ok, 3 Stars. The room had all we needed, 3 Stars. Well done President Hotel on your 3 Star Hotel. As it was a leap year when we stayed here my partner proposed to me...........YES. We left this nice 3 Star hotel engaged.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: nogsie
Reviews.Content: We were a bit unsure as some reviewers weren't too impressed with this hotel. We have stayed in many places of varying styles and star ratings. The negative comments from previous reviewers were not a problem for us at all. The staff are mainly from other countries but we found them to be very pleasent, helpful and happy. Just smile, say hello and you will get a great response! There are plenty of staff, whether to assist with purchasing attraction tickets to simply opening the front doors for you. The room was perfectly clean and fine. Sure, with the window open you can hear traffic noise, but you are in the theatreland of London!!!!! Enjoy the hustle and bustle! The cleaners room was right opposite ours but at no point were we disturbed with any noise or any problem. Breakfast was buffet style and perfectly fine. Russell Square tube is literally in the next street and Euston train station a 5 min walk up the main road - not a problem. The British Museum is just across the Square. We walked to Charing Cross, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Piccadilly. All within wandering distance for you. Loads of places to eat and drink - the cafe in Russell Square outside the hotel food was good, as was the verdi restaurant, turn left on the main road (Southampton Row), friendly and with a pianist nightly and nice food and wine. The President Hotel has a doorway link into the Imperial Hotel next door with a bar, shop, hairdresser, casino etc. Don't be put off this hotel if you are having a theatre break in London, the location was great and we had a great stay. PS. Go on the London RIB speedboat on the Thames, it was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_toots
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends last summer on a theatre break weekend. The hotel is in a good location within walking distance of lots of the main attractions and with bars and restaurants nearby. Rooms were adequate and quite quiet. Only downside for us was that the hotel bar was quite small and dated, although there wasn't many other people in it. Perfectly fine for a budget break.

Reviews.Title: “our trip to london”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before It is a 3star hotel.You get what you pay for.We had a nice clean room.Thr reception staff were very nice on check in we even had a free meal on our first evening.and a bottle of wine at Â£11.50 that was drinkable we have no complaints.The hotel is very central and whithin walking distance to the westend. we used the buses quite a bit and they were just out side the hotel with the tube the same distance away .A Tescos opposite thetube station handy for a cold bottel of wine for your room.We had 2nights at this hotel and will use it again when we go to London.We went on A Superbreak excellent value for money.Saw three shows.Great break.Thank you to staff at this hotel for being so wellcoming. Margaret.Mirfield

Reviews.Title: “Desparate”
Reviews.Author: brian m
Reviews.Content: How desparate are you? With exception of the front staff, this hotel NEEDS a major renovation. Amenities-----forget it! Continental breakfast------chewing a piece of something being passed off as toast and drinking tea that could compete with battery acid is not my idea of a good start to the day.We have travelled in over 30 countries and this hotel is by far the worst . Norman Bates Hotel could probably beat The President-----bm---Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: wackyNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a theatre break, staying at the President Hotel. I only checked Trip Advisor after we booked because the reviews on the Super Break website were good. I agree with the other reviewers who said the hotel is convenient for Kings Cross, Oxford Street and theatres. I was worried the hotel would not be clean but in fact, it was fine. The rooms are very basic - adequate probably describes them well. The heat in the rooms was unbearable and we couldn't leave the window open because of traffic noise. The breakfast was poor. You can't really go wrong with cereal but the cooked food was inedible, the toast was soggy and the fruit was tinned. we chose to eat out at the local Apostrophe cafe in the Brunswick shopping centre, just opposite Russell Square tube station. It was worth the extra cost. A great attraction to visit is the British Museum, just across Russell Square. we only spent a short time there to fill in time before our return train but the exhibitions are amazing! Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: VICTORIAFife
Reviews.Content: A very central hotel for easy reach by foot for all London attractions.The hotel needs a bit of an update but room was clean and spacious got a good deal through easy breaks not a top class hotel but the location is well worth the stay.The breakfast was ok and busy dining room but enough tables would stay again

Reviews.Title: “President Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fairfield23
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice at this hotel, last time Jan 2012, with two friends and have found it to be excellent value for money, especially if wanting single rooms. This hotel is within easy walking distance from Euston station and is convenient for Russel Square underground if you do not want to walk to attractions and theatres. Have not had any problems with noise, and found the staff to be pleasant and helpfull. Have booked for bed and breakfast, and had no complaints with standard of food. Bedrooms and bathrooms have both times been a reasonable size, with bath and shower, and have been clean and comfortable. Have already booked this hotel for next January.

Reviews.Title: “Noise!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ripto
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here before an early morning train out of St. Pancras International. Was continually disturbed throughout the night by bottles being thrown into bins, and noise from other guests arriving. If you want a good night's sleep do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out!! Theres a thief about!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LA1_11
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday afternoon, checked in quickly, although not one member of staff (I spoke to) was English. Went to our room, which was dated and small, we only had one pillow and one towel. We spoke to the reception staff and they called the housekeeping staff to sort it out. We were given 1 extra pillow and 1 extra towel, 2 in total!! That evening, we had an evening meal in the restaurant, upon check in we were told we had to order by 21.30pm, I was at the entrance to the restaurant for 21.10pm, an older female member of staff shouted "YES" at me, I explained that we had an evening meal booked and she replied they were closing, I stated that we were told, they werent supposed to stop serving (last orders) until 21.30. The female member of staff (who again spoke with a foreign accent) pointed over at a table as she walked in the opposite direction.She was very rude!!! On our first morning, we were woken up by the housing keeping staff, unfortunately we were in Room 428 and their store room was directly opposite, there are exceptionally loud, laughing and messing about at approximately 07.45am!! Brilliant wake up call, no need to set your alarm! The WORSE thing to happen to me was; I ended up rushing for our train home on Valentines day and left my diamonte earrings (a gift from a friend in Australia) and swarovski crystal necklace (A Christmas gift from my husband) in a glass on the bathroom sink. I only realised when I was sitting on the train at Kings Cross. I rang the hotel immediately and was eventually put through to a foreign speaking female on reception, who told me to ring back in the afternoon, this was at 13.30, we left the hotel at 13.15. I rang back 3 times and eventually left my mobile number. One of the managers Mrs Mcdowel rang back to say nothing had been left!!!!!!!! As I have no proof to who had my jewellery I cannot go around making accusations, however when speaking with Mrs Mcdowel, she stated that my husband and I were accusing her staff of stealing, which we never did, although I know where I left my jewellery and now they are saying nothing was there!!!! YES IT BLOODY WAS!!!!!! I am truly gutted that our brilliant London trip was spoilt by, yes my forgetfullness, but also the hotel's and staff's, lack of personality, manners and understanding. I just hope someone, somewhere will enjoy wearing my jewels as much as I did! Becareful and dont forget anything, you may not see it ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: clwydaerials
Reviews.Content: We are 3 elderly people and stayed at the president hotel for 3 nights, found the hotel good, room clean, breakfast good but could have been hotter, staff verry good and informative, good for underground and busses. Have booked again for june. Keith

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: INDIAS
Reviews.Content: Taking into account hotel prices in London, this is a great-value choice. Very good location, close to British Museum & a metro station on the corner. Clean, good space in the rooms, safe area. Very complete buffet breakfast, you almost don't need to have lunch! No doubt I will return. People complanin about the key! yes, it is big, bu't you never have to carry it outside! think about what is important, and these things are very well covered at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: urawareds0001
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff but more 1970s hostel than hotel. Wouldn't go again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean 3 star hotel, good location and decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mal W
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during the week. Staff at Reception were helpful on checking in and the room was easy to find. The room itself was basic and looked dated, however it was warm and clean with crisp sheets and a firm but comfortable mattress. The breakfast was good with the usual choice of items from a buffet which was not as hot as it could be but it tasted good. At the end of the day you get what you pay for and I was happy with what I got for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Bed is too hard”
Reviews.Author: clearmoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the weekend. Very convenient to tube station and shops. Room is a bit dated. Needs updating. Bed is too hard and didn't particularly have a very good night. Good selection of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was cold”
Reviews.Author: Wardy52
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights. The location is OK, our room was clean, & the staff are polite, friendly & helpful. The only downside was the breakfast - although the selection of food was good, it was all barely luke warm. As the President is a well-established hotel, I would have thought that this type of problem would not occur. Urgent attention is required with regard to adjusting the temperature of the hot plates & thereby ensuring that everyone gets a hot breakfast. Also, the tea & coffee were both extremely poor, in fact the tea did not resemble tea at all - it looked more like mud. We will not return, & would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, comfortable & clean”
Reviews.Author: Toony44
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in this hotel. It is in an ideal location for the tube and is surrounded by loads of places of interest. The complimentary carvery on the first night was very good and for breakfast there was a wide range of food to choose from and it was well cooked. A bit of queueing on a weekend but then it is a big hotel. The room was of an acceptable size, clean and comfortable and had all the usual amenities. The shower had good pressure and there was always hot water. All in all I would definately recommend this to friends and family and would have no hesitation staying there myself again. One slight niggle - it is the first time I have been charged to leave my luggage once I had checked out, however it was only 50p per bag so it didn't break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Rogert41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location for The British Museum and many of the Theatres but we found the hotel itself to be very disappointing - probably worth 2.5 stars rather than 3. The communal corridors are gloomy and depressing and the room in which we stayed was functional at best. The main dining room is cramped and resembles a cafeteria more than a restaurant. The breakfast was OK but, nothing special. This was part of a Theatre break and I guess that this was a classic case of getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service, Clean & Comfortable Rooms: Best Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Jazmin07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the President Hotel for 9 nights, so I hope my comments don't arise from first impressions. The President is located very close to public transport (London Underground Piccadilly Line, bus stops to many routes, cabs). It is an easy and delightful walk to Russell Square and the British Museum. The exceptionally helpful, knowledgeable and courteous reception staff (my gratitude goes especially to Don and Glenn) made my tours around London (on foot & public transport) much more enjoyable: these praiseworthy gentlemen gave me a lot of useful advice, and patiently answered to my satisfaction my many questions. My (single) room on the 1st floor was cleaned thoroughly every morning; towels, toilet paper and soap were replenished daily; the beddings were clean and fresh; and the bed was comfortable to sleep on. Except for 2 late nights when some very loud and vulgar women next door to my room yelled incessantly, and banged their door with so much force more than a dozen times (Surely, some people in other rooms must have complained to management! My own tolerance prevented me from doing so; please accept my excuse.), I slept peacefully and comfortably for the remaining 7 nights. Although the Continental breakfast was included with my pre-booked accomodation, I chose to pay extra every morning to partake of the full English breakfast, which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “3 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky H
Reviews.Content: I work in a travel agents and wouldnt recommend this hotel if I agreed with these people who slate this hotel, ive stayed here myself and it is , yes lets repeat a 3 star hotel not 5, 3 its brilliant location, perfect for shopping and meals out :-) the rooms are basic (3 star, remember) and the breakfast IS fine. perfect base for weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FRANK N
Reviews.Content: Good location and helpful staff, bedrooms are good as long as you don't have to spend too long in them. The breakfasts are adequate to poor, with cooked breakfasts being warm, rather than hot. If you want a good breakfast probably best to skip it and have it elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: safetymatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in January while visiting London to watch a show, there are quite a few negative reviews which from my experience I disagree with. Stayed on the 3rd floor, very clean room, and nice comfortable bed, bathroom was spotless, my only negative really was that the bath towels were very small so didn't dry you very well. Breakfast was pretty good, did the usual fry up and went down nicely. The location is great, literally 2 minutes walk from Russell Sq tube station and on the way to the hotel is a great little pub called the Friend at Hand, had a least 3 visits there and very good value. All in all a good experience and would use The President again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Eugene3739
Reviews.Content: I used it for 1 night stay before going to Brussels from St. Pancras. Excellent location, close to everything. Clean and convenient room with bathroom in good condition. Lobby and elevators looked uninspiring, and breakfast was even less inspiring, so I didn't eat it. Huge door key was quite strange and not convenient to use. Overall exactly what I paid for. If you don't require luxurious lobby look and extra conveniences, this place is good for you. Don't buy their breakfast, don't look much around getting from the front door to your room, and there will be nothing to be really unhappy about. Clever budget soution.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the British National Museum and Tube Station Steps Away!”
Reviews.Author: jessicav85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while on a Contiki tour. That being said, expect many 18-35s buzzing around. The beds were hard, the rooms sort of noisy. Typical CRT TV in the room. However, the location was awesome! Steps away from Russel Square, Covent Garden, a large shopping plaza, the Britsh National Museum, and a Tube station. Only about 15 mins to Westminister station on the tube line. I would stay there for location only. The keys are pretty weird and are on a long stick.

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: nicthemuppet05
Reviews.Content: the service was first class and would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Christina1960
Reviews.Content: Been to this hotel 5 times in the last two years fantastic base for theatre breaks within 10 mintue walk from kings cross station, russell street underground round the corner. Hotel clean (not 5 star) but is all thats required to much to see to be sitting in hotel. good breakfast and have on several occasions had free meal one night of two night stay. Hotel bar reasonably priced. would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-Rude reception-Needs Renewal NOW!”
Reviews.Author: limassol78
Reviews.Content: Been in London early April for a wedding. Choose this hotel for location and should say that this is the one to use when on vacations in London. BUT: its true that there is no need to say anymore about this hotel than :Needs Renewal NOW!!!!! It must been since early 80'sthat this hotel has changed fitted or change anything at all. And for god sake, Change the keyring!!!!!!!! Its at least wrong to carry a whole foot long metallic stick around along with your key!!!! People has gone to the moon and back. Magnetic cards are around. As for Reception the least i can say is they are way too rude. The rest of the staff, especially the Lady we met everyday at breakfast(seemed to be in charge) are quite friendly and helpful. Now if i mention location i should say its excellent and nothing less. Underground (Russel Square station) and Tesco (24convienience store) are 100 steps away. That is less than one minute walk from the hotel. Bus station is 2 minutes walk. Pubs and small casino is just next to Hotels main door on the right and left. As for shopping, Oxford street is 7 minutes away thru Underground. DO choose Russel Square for staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SonjaBirnbaum
Reviews.Content: It's true that this hotel is tad old, a refurbishment wouldn't hurt it at all. Still, it's clean and the location couldn't be more perfect. Russell Square tube station is right around the corner and there are a lot of bus stops nearby. Furthermore, it's very close to the British Museum and the staff is really friendly. In terms of breakfast, my booking included the Continental breakfast, which was very poor, consisting only of bread, butter and jam and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “xmas break for 4”
Reviews.Author: david m
Reviews.Content: Having being able to check in to the hotel before the stipulated time we were able to see the sights of london before dinner, yes there was a short queue for pre drinks and for dinner THAT NIGHT but the staff were friendly and it wasnt long before we were at our table. Throughout our stay over christmas the food ,service and how helpful and ATTENTATIVE the staff were. This was a brilliant christmas experience break for us and we did have the tickets to london eye which werent expected and a bonus. So from the Mavis taylor family brilliant and thank you

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulh29
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 2 night break in this hotel, to be pickey a few of the hallways look like they could do with a coat of paint. However, the hotel overall was clean,staff friendly and the breakfast great. the hotel is idealy located and has great links for bus and tube travel. I would have no hesitation about staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 60gone
Reviews.Content: Not only are you only 1 block from the tube but Russell Square is a major bus hub. Perfect for British Museum & Library, Covent Garden. Convenient ATM,post office, pub, and cafes. Hotel staff was great, friendly & efficient.We asked for early check in - room was waiting when we arrived at 10am. A few quirks, (old fashioned keys on long rods, tall sinks and platform showers, beds on rollers) - no extra frills, (bring your own shampoo.) Tthe full breakfast buffet - eggs, meat, fresh fruit - was a lifesaver, We stayed as part of a British Air package so even better than normally reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: NorthernRyan
Reviews.Content: First of all, the best thing about this hotel is its location. Just behind Russell Square Underground station, and a 15 minute walk from Kings Cross and St Pancras railway stations. There are a couple of bus stops nearby as well. There is also a Tesco Express close by. The hotel itself isn't too bad. The rooms are a little dated, but are clean, which is very important to me. The breakfast was disappointing, but there are numerous cafes around the area.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ardmore27
Reviews.Content: I visited this Hotel on the 10th and 11th of December and I had a great time. The breakfast was buffet style(eat as much as you like).It was a good fill up for the day (I did not have to buy lunch).I had a single room on the 7th floorJust about ideal for 1.The hotel was very busy (and the under was just around the corner) which is usually a good sign.Had a couple of drinks in the bar and prices were very competitive over all I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Gill393
Reviews.Content: My friend and i travel every xmas for a couple fo days, usually i book myself as i like a small hotel rather than the larger hotels usually offered by travel Agent. Booked with my local agent, we wanted central because for ease of getting around. No need to use the tube but it is round the corner from the hotel. Larger than i like but reception welcoming, room clean, breakfast was usual fare bacon, eggs sausage etc, didnt fancy the fish though. Left some of my clothes and they were sent on within the week which quite surprised me. So all in all an enjoyalbe stay in pleasant enought hotel. PS used the bar at the front of the hotel which served very good fish n chips and large wine wot more could a girl want after a day shopping.

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid”
Reviews.Author: ericYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my wife to London for her birthday and see "Phantom" , we booked two nights at the President ................that was my first mistake,the second was to have paid in advance. We arrived at the hotel and were allocated a room by an Irish lady at reception who then handed us two vouchers for dinner at the hotel and she advised us that they had to be used on our first night at the hotel . I advised her that we had not been told about the vouchers and had booked a meal at a restaurant close to the theatre for the first night .I then asked could we use them the following night to be met with a brusk "No they can only be used on the first night , it is not flexible" I asked what difference it made if we used them the first or second night and she replied "it is not flexible, they have to be used on your first night" ................ I thought great customer care and we haven't even got to the room. I didn't have time to argue about it as we were on a tight schedule to get to the theatre but I should have read the signs and turned around and found another hotel , I really should have but unfortunately I had pre-paid. The room could only be described as pokey, dated and smelling of stale cigarettes ..........but we just didn't have the time to do anything but drop our bags and set off to the theatre .I was reluctant to contact reception in view of the treatment we had previously been subject to. We opened the window to freshen up the room and left.On our return we had an opportunity to have a good look at the room and it left a lot to be desired , the tiles around the shower were mouldy (see photo), the rail rusty (Photo) , the vent full of dust and dirt (photo), the dust was hanging off the top of the bathroom door(Photo) and the shower curtain discoloured. The bed was provided with only one pillow and on trying to get to bed we were faced with the dilema of being stifled in the room with the window closed or opening the window and being hit by the traffic noise . We spent two very uncomfortabe and sleepless nights at the hotel . Breakfast...................what can I say................. it looked like we were back in a holiday camp in the 1950's ............ queuing for food , machines for coffee or tea , cold and soggy toast......we ended up going round the corner to one of the little French Cafes for breakfast .Breakfast in the hotel was the stuff of our worst nightmares and in a funny way we were glad we couldn't use the vouchers in the hotel restaurant and the second night we went to a fabulous little French restaurant called Denise's just around the corner in Southampton Row a two minutes walk away. What a difference .................. fabulous food and really great, friendly service , the Dover Sole was superb and I understand from the same fishmonger who supplies Buckingham Palace no less. On our return to the hotel on the second night we received a phone call telling us not to use the kettle to make tea as the power socket was defective!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! but we had already been there for two days........................ it brought to mind the carry on films with Kenneth Williams out in the corridor uttering those immortal words "Frying Tonight" Housekeeping woke us very early the first morning with their loud chattering in the hallway , someone needs to tell them to be quiet as people are likely to be still asleep at 7:30am .The second morning we were awoken by banging from the room next door and when we left to go out for breakfast there was a tradesman\decorator working on the bedroom next door.Again did nobody think about the fee-paying guests in the room next door , in our opinion a total lack of consideration. All in all a most unpleasant experience from our viewpoint and the only redeeming point was the concierge staff who were very helpful. If you are in London there have to be better hotels where customers are taken care of and not treated like cattle. An hotel that we will never ever return to.

Reviews.Title: “You wonâ€™t like this hotel, but you probably wonâ€™t mind it.”
Reviews.Author: Teamtango
Reviews.Content: I only stay here because its location is great for a regular exhibition I attend every year. I stay 2 nights and as long as you only need a bed and you like the location then this place will suit you. Above all else it is great value as I paid Â£102 per night including breakfast â€“ pretty good for central London. What you get are small rooms but quite comfortable. They all need a refurb but are clean and the bathroom is ok too. Service is so so, not good but not bad. So if money is tight and you only need a crash pad this hotel is excellent. If you need a hotel for quality, big rooms, top service then look elsewhere. But youâ€™ll certainly pay a lot more for central London if this is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Fine service - renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Erikdk
Reviews.Content: The President offers value for your money. Saying that is is not luxury, and the continental breakfast is very basic. Services at the reception and the consierge ar fine. Location is a litlle outside - app. 25 minutes from Covent Garden and Lecister Square. Good transport-connections, so buy yourself an OysterCard for buses and Underground. Could expect free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: renee4u
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay , Room was very clean ,new bath, everything was great except the bed was a bit hard. My partner was comfy but due to my small frame I felt as if their was a pea under the mattress. Great location staff was great , of course they were very busy while we were there during mid term. I will stay there again for sure. Looking forward to it. Close to the tube lots of great stuff in the area.

Reviews.Title: “PRICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: georgiagi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, the breakfast AWFUL and the smells bad. But the place is good for the value. It has a good location, easy to arrive, and comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LoveToSki1971
Reviews.Content: Yes the room rate is reasonable and the location is great for access to Russell Square station, but: Rooms are really dated Stained dirty windows Bin not emptied from previous occupant Dirty light switches (no excuse for not being clean) Desk chair is damaged Mattress feels old and springy Bathroom is actually clean and ok (best bit of the room)! My company booked me into this hotel and I certainly won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “CHOOSE ANOTHER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sarahanne1
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location, it is right next to Russell Square underground station. We walked into our room and the smell of cigarettes was so overpowering, even though we had the windows open each time we were in the room the smell did not get any better, we had to wash all our clothes as soon as we got home, even the ones we had not worn. The first morning we went for breakfast at the hotel, it was buffet, the food was lukewarm and went cold very quickly especially as the plates were cold. The toast was like rubber. The second morning we went to Pret a Manger as we couldn't face another breakfast in the hotel. I wouldn't recommend staying here again, although after reading some of the reviews maybe we just had a really bad room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: rataber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, close to main line railway stations, pubs, restaurants, London shopping and the British museum. The room was clean and tidy (although a little run down). If you are taking breakfast, get down early to avoid long queues. The breakfast room even then is a bit cramped. Overall a reasonable choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: smoosh_me
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently with my partner for a short break. Having previously stayed at the Royal National we were assured the President was slightly better and we were not disappointed! We had a room overlooking the park, and although it was slightly noisey at times, the room was perfect for what we needed. Comfy, clean bed, decent, hot shower and there was a flat screen tv we put on while we were getting ready to go out. We found all the staff to be perfectly nice, all friendly and knowledgeable. We only went to breakfast one day as I wasnt keen on the choice of food or the atmosphere in the breakfast room. (its was quite old fashioned and a bit like having breakfast in a funeral parlour!) However, the hotel is just minutes from a pret, tescos and other shops and cafes so this wasnt too much of a problem. The location of the hotel really couldnt be any better! Seconds from Russell Square underground and you can be in the middle of Covent Garden in ten minutes. Overall, I would definately stay in this hotel again, we had no problems and it was certainly value for money, clean and in such a great location for getting around London!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: woody2762
Reviews.Content: The President is a good hotel, well located in the Bloomsbury section of London. The room I stayed in was big for London and clean with a bathroom that had serious water pressure (it was like going through a car wash, I loved it!). It's a two minute walk to the Russell Square Tube, a five minute walk to the British Museum and 15 minutes to Soho. I purchased a package deal with flight and hotel and it turned out to be a great value. On the down side, the continental breakfast included toast and jam, peeled oranges, grapefruit and prunes, cold cereal and rolls. You can pay a minimal amount to upgrade to the English breakfast, but I didn't bother. The staff could be a little more friendly. It's not that they were rude, but every time I needed to ask a question, they looked annoyed. For price and location you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Back to President for more of the same”
Reviews.Author: Rybas
Reviews.Content: Knowing exactly what I'm letting myself in for (tired general outlook, long lines for English breakfast after 8:30), I returned to President, this time with my family. We wanted adjoining rooms and we got them; we wanted 1 twin and 1 double, got that too. The rooms we got this time were, if anything, cleaner adn somewhat refreshed in comparison with 15 months ago. What has not changed (duh) was the location, which is this hotel's greatest asset. All in all, in overpriced London, this is probably the best you get get for this price. What changed for the worse was the supply of toiletries - only soap received without asking; shampoos had to be dragged out of the housekeeper - come ON!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the President Hotel for a weekend break, the room was small but had what you needed and most important clean, the breakfast was very good with lots of choice. The hotel is in a very good location and we never needed to use transport to get anywhere, we just walked, Oxford Street, the river and Covent Gardens all only took a few minutes. I would definately recomend this hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Location, etc.”
Reviews.Author: eurofoot
Reviews.Content: The President Hotel in Russell Square offers one of the best locations in London. A short walk to the British Museum, the British Library, many great pubs and the Russell Square Tube station giving you access to all of London. The President is a large commercial hotel, not a luxury house, rather impersonal but for the outstanding Bellman, Glenn. He has all the answers and is happy to help. The hotel is clean, efficient and I think, a training ground for desk clerks, none of whom seem very experienced. This hotel has some has some rooms opening on an air shaft that are to be avoided. Any of the outside rooms are fine. My wife and I have stayed at the President for many years, there has been remodeling including a new elevator system and work in the rooms, these changes are for the better, but the location rules.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MKM2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of November 2011. The best thing about the hotel was its location- very convenient for the tube and also within walking distance of Euston station and the British Museum. Gave easy access theatres and other attractons. The immediate area around the hotel is also very pleasant. Check in went smoothly and was fast and efficient. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming. The lobby itself was in need of updating. The hotel itself was very dated and in need of some TLC. The walls in the room were very bare and a few pictures may have added some atmosphere. The facilities were adequate with kettle, TV and hairdryer. However, there was no on room safe. The bed was comfortable, although the bedding looked worn. The bathroom was adequate, clean and had a good shower.The room was quiet. Breakfast was disappointing- very crowded and the food was cold and the toast soggy. We chose to eat outside the hotel on our second morning. The table cloths were dirty and we observed one of the waiters dropping cutlery on the floor and then placing it back on the table. It was difficult to find a clean glass or plate. The breakfast staff were not particularly friendly and were not welcoming. The hotel was adequate for a nights sleep after a day/ evening out in London. However, we would probably not stay here again as there appear to be better hotels in a similar class.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BikerHarrogate
Reviews.Content: Had a two day break in London and stayed at the President, Russell Square. London Break with train Â£128 per person. no problems with the hotel other than we appeared to be directly above the kitchens and the smell of cooking fish tended to permiate upwards. Well worth considering if you just want a couple of days in the 'smioke;

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in London. Stayed at the president hotel in Russell Square. The hotel was really easy to find walking from Kings Cross Station. Check in was a breeze, staff very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are basic but clean. Prior to going I checked out a lot of different reviews, I wish I hadn't bothered. They were very negative and were actually putting me off going, however this hotel was perfect. If you want a hotel with all mod cons and a bell boy then this is not the hotel for you. What you get here is a value for money hotel in the centre of London walking distance from all the attractions and a tube station if you don't want to walk. For all these other negative reviewers, get a life, away and spend 3 or 4 times the money on a different hotel for the same outcome, somewhere for you to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne B
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here only for one night which as we found out was more than enough. When we arrived at the hotel checking in was ok but the staff overall weren't friendly and looked miserable all the time. We waited for our key at one point from the porter but noone was there and the girls on reception were just chatting away without showing any acknowledgement of us or anyone else. On the evening I had to ring reception as our kettle wasn't working and it took ages for someone to come up to our room and when they did it took them even longer to bring a new kettle and during this time the electricity went off in our room and wasn't fixed for nearly an hour. Also when we emptied the sink the water and muck rose up in bath which was disgusting. The next morning we went down for breakfast but I would advise you to get there early because it does get quite busy. There was plenty food to choose from but it was just say warm so wasn't enjoyable at all. The only positive thing I can say about our stay was it was quite close to train station and close to shops and pubs.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN BUDGET, TIRED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireKillieboy
Reviews.Content: In a good location close to other hotels in Imperial Group. Room was ok, and clean, but somewhat tired - however, at just over Â£100, a good budget price so central on Russell Square. Not a good web service for booking, and the key, on a 12 in stalk, was antiquated, to say the least. Lots of noise from air conditioning fans outside. Lots of tourists, but bars and didning room not recommended- much better smaller restaurants in surrounding area. Overall, tolerable for a night !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel bit of a let down - although decent location”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaKms
Reviews.Content: Just returned we stayed for 3 nights, the location of the hotel is good as it is just round the corner from Russell Square tube station. However the hotel itself has a few downsides. The bedroom was far too hot and because of this we had to have window open and it was very very noisy. We asked for our heating to be turned off but had to ask twice and it was still too hot.The walls are very thin and it sounded as though next door were actually having a bath in our bathroom. You could hear every little noise. The hotel was clean and the bathroom was very clean although the towels were old and didnt smell very fresh. There was no information whatsoever in the room regarding hotel facilities, not even the number to dial for reception. The breakfast experience was a bit of a nightmare, there was never any tables and you had to look around for one they were never cleared very quickly. The toast was cold and soggy. The hot breakfast looked a bit tired. There were never any saucers or teaspoons. It was total chaos in the mornings. On the whole however the hotel was adequate for our needs as we only slept here and had our breakfast as we were out all day and only returned to sleep. The best thing about it was the proximity to Euston station and the tube. We would not return to this hotel as we have been in better ones for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: christinewigan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a short break. Good location and value for money. If you want more you need to pay more, simple as that. Basic, but no problems. Breakfast ok.. But not much, a bit of chaos is expected.. Staff very friendly. Enjoyed our time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night but wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: JamesTw
Reviews.Content: We booked a London show through SuperBreak.Com via, a Travel Agent and they recommended the President Hotel as its supposed to be popular with their guests. I suppose Â£100 for a double room with English Breakfast isn't that bad a deal for a London Hotel but if I did it again I would pay extra and stay somewhere a bit better. The hotel isn't bad its just not that great a place when you break it down. Clean enough but the decor needs a little bit updating and the breakfast was pretty average. Do these establishments go out of their way to source the cheapest, fattiest bacon they can get their hands on? It's a 3 star hotel and the facilities in the bedrooms are adequate as its all there, such as a small flat screen TV and hairdryer. The bathroom had no extraction so steamed up pretty quickly and I personally hate those showers where you use the taps to mix the temperature and flick a switch to transfer the water to the shower head as the pressure drops and you alway get too hot or too cold a flow of water coming through. There was coffee making facilities available but only enough for one cup which is pretty mean, and no biscuits The hotel is about 15 minutes from Covent Garden and another 10 minutes to the Queens Hotel where we saw our show but our Porter recommended getting the tube to Picadilly Station which we did but had I known it was as easy to walk too we would have walked instead as there's a lot going on in the area. A pretty good location but an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Your-MandS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 5 friends for a birthday weekend away. It was ok for we wanted but if i was to go for a weekend away with my husband i'd choose a higher class hotel. We checked in on Friday afternoon and checked out on the Sunday morning. When we checked in we requested rooms on the same floor and the hotel were very accomodating. It does go without saying that you get what you pay for. We only paid Â£120 pp for travel and accomodation with breakfast included and the hotel and breakfast reflected this so i was not expecting much before we arrived. Activities we did when we were there were: Tea at Harrods Theater Meal at Le meridien Madame Tussauds Our location was idea for all of the activities we choose to do. Also, a few of us went to the salon that is joined to the hotel for an afternoon treat and they were very friendly and my friend said it was best hair cut she had ever had!! I would reccomend the hotel for a cheap trip away with friends if you are not expecting to spend much time in the hotel. I hope this helps with your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a London Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mitochondrial
Reviews.Content: We booked into the President for our supersaver weekend break. The hotel is central and within walking distance of the west end and Covent garden for two active 60+ yr olds! It is also only 25mins case pull from Kings Cross/ St Pancras stations. The hotel is tired and needs re furbishing but it was clean and a good buffet full english breakfast was available, but you are eating in a busy room with over 100 other holiday makers. Bedrooms were fine. Considering the cost of the weekend package this hotel is fine, but personally I prefer the Royal National across the road which has a better breakfasting area.Try the Britsh Museum on a Sunday morning, open from 10am, within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit less than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kikka1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located. A two minute walk to the underground. The tube goes straight to Heathrow airport to all the terminals. That is defiinetly a plus. Otherwise the hotel is nothing to write home about. It needs refurbishment very badly. The room was spacious and the bathroom in good working condition. We had to leave the bedroom window open at all times as the heat in the room was unbearable. Breakfast was a total disaster. We were entitled to continental breakfast which consisted of tea/coffee/milk, ready made toast, jam and cereal. I took a look at the buffet breakfast which was the same as ours plus baked beans, poached and scrambled eggs and bacon. It definetly wasn't worth the money we paid for except for its good location. The waiters during breakfast time were ever so rude. Non

Reviews.Title: “forgetable”
Reviews.Author: peter j
Reviews.Content: some hotels are memorable either good or bad. the hotel president is not one of them it is simplyforetable,nothing sticks out with this hotel it is simply a bit less than average. the location isn't bad near to the underground and not far from the british meseum. however with this hotel everything else is if not poor then just on the right side of acceptable, the reception is very impersonal, the room while clean was a little worn as was the towels and bedding, the breakfast was simply o.k. nothing exciting just mass produced food in a self service system the evening menu like everything else was just unexciting just standard produce in a standard dining room. while the hotel did what we wanted from it providing a place to sleep for a few nights while we explored london it did nothing to add to the experience it seemed more like a people warehouse than a welcoming caring place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting place I have ever set foot in!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xShopaholicx
Reviews.Content: I'm actually disgusted I had to even give it a 1/5 rating, if only I could give it minus! I agree with the post where this "3 star hotel" is referred to as a homeless shelter. It certainly isn't a hotel! I have stayed in 3 star hotels before and as a minimum you expect a clean but more basic room than higher ratings but cleanliness being the key! We booked our trip last minute and were told it was a basic hotel but clean and had nice breakfast so we thought we would chance it. We have stayed in 3* hotels before Jurys inn's and Travelodges and they have all been clean. On arrival we were giving the most pokey and filthy room I have ever seen. We immediately complained that we weren't happy and were moved to another room that was being cleaned. Again it looked filthy but as we were told it was being cleaned we thought we would see afterwards. We phoned our travel agent straight away and said how dirty it was and could we pay to change hotels as we weren't happy. The operator we booked with said because it was after 12 we checked in we would have to pay that night (despite check in being 2pm and it was a complaint on hygiene!) We paid extra to stay at the Thistle 3 Star Bloomsbury park the 2nd night as we knew it would have just completely ruined our trip. Once we got into our new room it was filthy, shabby and what would be best described as a hostel. There were damp patches, dirt, graffiti on the furniture and just horrible! It looks like it hasn't been updated since the 1950s. Everything felt grimey. I ran my finger across the window sill and coated with thick dust and grit. Lovely! Breakfast the next morning was quite possibly the worst food I have ever seen and I am actually tempted to alert the health inspectors. The waiter sat us down to a filthy table with stains all over the table cloth so we moved. When we attempted to pour a glass of orange juice it took many attempts to find a clean glass without foot stuck to them. Same with the plates. food embedded on every plate I picked up. Vile! This was before seeing what they called the food! Yellow liquid with fish floating in... looked like a washing up bowl in a school dining hall. The bacon was fatty and under cooked. There were dirty plates and glasses strewn across the "buffet" area. I couldn't bear to put any of that in my mouth. I picked up a soggy piece of toast and that was enough to send us to Starbucks down the road! We promptly checked out and filled in a complaint form. The lobby is not what I would describe as nice at all... not welcoming, suitcases all over the floor as no baggage area for left luggage and a eerie atmosphere where we felt like it was trapped in another time zone. Not to mention the big stick with the key which was lethal looking. I am being honest in writing this review as I don't want anyone else to make the same mistake as us and having to pay out more money for another hotel to escape this horror. If you want a disgusting hovel of a place to rest your head in scratchy sheets and rock hard towels this is the place for you!!! If on the other hand you have an ounce of respect for your health and have cleanliness as a priority check in at the 3 Star (yes same star rating.... God knows how!) Thistle Bloomsbury Park around the corner and it will feel like heaven! Or The Hilton Doubtletree (4 star) in Bloomsbury which is highly recommended! The area is lovely and a short stroll to Covent Garden and Theatre land. I'm just glad to have returned home in the knowledge that I have survived a night in this hell hole!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Niamhie1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We were really happy with the hotel, just what we needed, a clean and comfortable base in central London, ideal for sightseeing. We didn't spend too much time in the hotel but why would you when there is so much to see and do on your doorstep!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A tired but adequate budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RockmonkeySomerset
Reviews.Content: Near to Russell Square tube station, this hotel is fairly convenient for sightseeing, though it is a few tube stops from most attractions. Our 'view' looked over the back of the hotel into a quadrangle of walls and windows, through an old fashioned single pane window with no safety locks (slightly worrying if you have young children). The room was tired with rickety, cup-stained furniture and cheap beds but the bathroom was clean and the shower was warm and powerful. My biggest complaint was the stifling heat of our room even in a mild November which didn't lend itself to a good nights sleep. The restaurant was okay and the breakfast ticked all the normal boxes for hotel fare, full english, cereal and fruit were offered though I would avoid turning up at 9am if you don't want to get caught up in a scrum as we did. I found the restaurant staff monosyllabic and grumpy which may have been exacerbated by some of the vile guests we found ourselves being elbowed by as they "dived for the trough". The bar was clean and well laid out with friendly staff. OVerall an adequate, if uninspiring venue .

Reviews.Title: “disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellen59186518
Reviews.Content: you woujld be better in a salvation army homeless hostel breakfast is disgustimg. toast is already made so it cold and hard. the fish was swimming in grease as was the bacon and sausages, and the fried eggs were rock solid. We also had to wait a good 15 minutes to be seated in a very overcrowded breakfast room when you are going out you must hand in the room key into reception which is attached to a long metal pole , be advised that the staff do not speak very good English the rooms are dirty and dated.The wallpaper was torn and had a damp patch on the ceiling. The bedding is a very itchy scratchy blanket with holes in it. There are no quilts, and 1 hard pillow, There is no central heating and the windows are not double glazed, in fact the windows look like something from an old school There are no irons in the room, you need to go to the iron room if you want to iron your clothes Honestly you wou ld be better of in a homeless hoistel, because this is what this hotel looks like I would never ever ever recommend this so called hotel, I wouljd call it more of a homeless hostel the only good thisg abot it is that the location is fab, anything else, well need i say anym,more

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service & location!”
Reviews.Author: Trysha
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here was some 10 years ago - the most recent time, earlier this month. I hold the same opinion I originally formed all those years ago: you can't beat this hotel for service & location "value for money". Ideally situated just off Russell Square, yet tucked away in a relatively quiet street, it provides very easy access to the Picadilly tube line as well as to wonderful bus routes. Prompt and pleasant service greets you from the time you initiate a booking enquiry, right through to checkout upon departure. Extra pillows late at night? Not a problem, the housekeeper delivers them personally, with a smile. A taxi to the station? Not a problem - the concierge will call one & let you know as soon as it arrives! Printout of your online airline checkin? Not a problem - the central office will handle that for you. In addition secure baggage storage should you require it......a big plus if you are wanting to do short trips away from London & not lug all your bags around with you. The rooms might not be ultra fancy - but they provide everything a traveller needs : a clean and comfortable bed - plenty of hot water - sufficient space to sort, press and pack away your clothes - tea & coffee in your room - free wi-fi....what more can I say!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Stuart2003
Reviews.Content: Good - Central location, rooms clean and tidy if a bit dated. Bathroom spotless and brilliant shower. Bed very comfy and noise level fairly low considering location. Bad - Breakfast was very poor (and I rarely complain about food), only had it 1 morning out of 3. That they can't really do toast says it all and the strange fish thing in yellow liquid was not the most appetising. Heating in the room was either on or off (boiling or freezing) but this was a minor irritant in the autumn. Overall a great basic base to explore London. Just don't book the breakfast and eat out.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Convenient Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Earnestly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as we went to a show at the Barbican Theatre (a lovely theatre) on the second night. The staff were very helpful and the bedroom was comfortable. Its location was excellent for us getting around and about. A couple of minutes walk from Russell Square Underground (A large lift takes you up and down to the underground level). Tables are readily available for breakfast and there was a good choice of food. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: LellyPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Friday to Sunday for a break in London. Arriving at 6pm Friday night our check in was quick and easy with friendly staff. Hotel reception did have a strange fishy smell, probably from the restaurant but nothing too unbearable. Our room was clean and tidy but basic - what we expected for what we paid. Good hot water all the time. Hotel bar, Day and Night located in Imperial hotel Which is adjacent to the President, was very reasonable for Drinks and food not bad at all. Breakfast was busy but food quiet good and plenty. Sometimes they sit you on a table with other guests as this happened to us on first morning. Location is probably the best thing. Good bus routes, 2 mins walk from Russell Square tube station and regular taxis passing. Quite area too as hotel is down a side street. Overall good place to stay if it's location you want for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: craggle82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Wed night for my birthday, me and my girlfriend were in london to watch a show, The hotel is in a perfect location for Theatre land, Its a 2 min walk from Russel Square tube station, its quiet and out of the way from the hustle and bustle of the main streets, The hotel itself is very big but always made to feel welcome, the rooms are basic but how long do you spend in your rooms when in london, Exactly, no need for all the perfet little bits that make you not want to leave the room, So much to see and do around the city you wont care, This doesnt mean the rooms are nasty, they are tidy, clean comfey, Have used the hotel twice now and would come back for our next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A HIDDEN GEM !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ferry27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the President for 2 nights on the 12th and 13th of october2011,and i must say we could not fault the place. Our room on the 2nd floor was spacious and spotless. Although the hotel reception was very busy,we were booked in within moments,and staff were so friendly..Our breakfast next morning was of a very good standard with a good choice of hot food ,and had great sleeps in our comfy beds .The price for our stay was minimum compared to some hotels,and when we next visit London we will be booking the President again ,and thanks to all staff for making our stay so enjoyable,Thanks from bonnie Scotland. .

Reviews.Title: “Grim hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: AGuest40
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the President in mid Oct 2011. I checked out 3 days earlier than booked because of illness and my distaste for the hotel. I read the reviews before I went and it was pretty clear that this was going to be a basic budget hotel which has a good central location at a good price for London. I got a single room on the 7th floor and when I checked in, the lobby was as to be expected. But I was genuinely shocked at how spartan and basic the 7th floor hall and my room were. The room was clean as advertised but the decor and ambience are absolutely appalling. I could only compare it to an inner city government rooming house for homeless people or similar. The walls were institutional off-white and the furniture, carpet and minimal decor were as basic and unattractive as could be imagined. The 7th floor has it's own elevator which is an old fashioned style which includes a large metal swinging door which slams shut loudly every time you enter the elevator. The elevator button had to be pressed twice every time since the inner folding door partly closes and then retracts back open every single time. The plain white walls around the elevator on the 7th floor are all graffittied and marked with pencil and it seems to have been that way for a long time. The continental breakfast was basic, just cereal, toast, fruit juices and small amounts of mashed fruit. The location is good, a short walk to Russell Square tube and only a slightly longer walk to Euston station. It is very close to the British museum. The staff were very helpful if asked in my experience. I read another recent review that described this hotel as "grim and depressing" and that sums it up for me. I stayed out as late as I could to avoid any unnecessary time sitting in my room. I would not stay here again. Perhaps the owners will put some money into this place and bring it up to a better standard. I would gladly have payed more to stay somewhere that was at least pleasant to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: jeffcook1
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 3 nights in this hotel. It is in a good location tube station just round the corner. Nice reception and bar to relax in after a day sightseeing and and reasonable prices at the bar. Hotel staff were very friendly, the carvey was excellant and good value for money, and the breakfast had plenty to choose from. This is the first time we have stayed here and we would stay here again when we go to London.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well run, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: CarolJohnson49
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you pay for. The room was dated but clean. The staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfast was well organized and freshly cooked (needs more fruit). For a well priced, tourist hotel in central London this was ideal. Location is excellent (1 minute's walk to the Tube)

Reviews.Title: “Low budget and low quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Activetravell3r
Reviews.Content: Small room with old fashion furniture and equipment. Despite its central position, all the services are very low quality. Breakfast food is bad and breakfast room is extremely crowded by noisy people, tough to find a spot to sit. They charge for any extra, even for luggage left in the look room (50 pennies a bag). I asked for Internet connection, and check-in guy told service does not run 24/7 but he was not able to indicate when service is active. Incredible! I will never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: missdundee84
Reviews.Content: I've just come back home after staying at this horrible hotel for the past four days. This hotel has gotta be one of the worst hotels/places i've stayed at in a long time. On arrival we went to check in and the loby smelt of urine. (My mum said it was fish!) After speaking very slowly to the receptionist (who was forgien) we were given a key to our room, which was a key on a long metal pole thing and told that everytime we go out we must leave it with the reception staff. (I felt like I was twelve years old handing my key back to my mum as I couldn't be trusted). We eventually got to our room which was small with two single beds in it. We asked what my daughter would sleep on and were given this fold down bed that was solid. The lovely bed came with a horrible itchy blanket which my daughter refused to sleep on, we asked if they could take it out and was advised that they couldnt due to health and safety so we were stuck with another bed in a very small room. The room itself was pretty dated, there was no air con or double glazing which was a nightmare as the hotel itself was very hot and when you leave the windows open at night you hear the bottle bins getting emptied which then wakes you up. There is a seperate toilet from the shower and sink which was quite weird, the wallpaper was ripped and black stains on the ceiling in the bathroom along with stains on the carpets and holes in the sheets! When we tried to speak to the staff about it they struggled gto understand us (our accents are not that bad!!) which made it even worse so in the end we just gave up and stayed out from about 10am until really late at night. The breakfast was a complete eye opener! It was a self service buffet style which in most hotels is fine. They had fish that to me looked like scrambled eggs due to the bubbly grease, they even cook the toast which is soggy and teh rest of the food at breakfast time is just awfull. If you can get past the chewyness of the toast and stick to cereal then you'll be fine! The location of the hotel is fab but that's the only fab thing about it. I would love to say that the staff are great, but to be honest they were not, dunno if it was the accent (even tho I have no problem anywhere else in the world speaking to people) the food is disgusting although the drink prices are good! The hotel desperatly needs a good clean and decent staff, give me a tent at a festival any day over this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Grim and a bit depressing”
Reviews.Author: CD1Newcastle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels around Russell Square, and this has to be the worst. The decor is pretty awful, breakfast was bad and our room wasn't a very pleasant place to be. The view over Russell Square was good, however. As there are loads of hotels in this area, I would recommend trying another.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chnich
Reviews.Content: Worried after reading many negative reviews, I found this hotel to be very welcoming. The staff was friendly, helpful, and efficient. Knowing about the rooms ahead of time was helpful. Ammenties were small bars of soap, packets containing tea, coffee, sugar and small packets of milk. Being forewarned, I took shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and shower gel. The only alarm available was a wake-up call. It was always at the time requested. The room was clean, although small (single room). The bathroom was also quite small. It might have felt a bit claustrophobic for a larger person. The tub was very narrow and the curtain kept sticking to me as I showered. The bed was a twin, but very comfortable. True, the tv didn't have a lot of variety, but I wasn't there to watch television. I loved being able to keep the windows open. As I walked around London, I smelled some of the sour odors mentioned in some reviews, but never at the hotel. Wifi was spotty. I could access in the lobby and once in a while in the room. The Continental breakfast was always the same, but plentiful for me. There were 4-5 choices of cold cereal, orange and grapefruit sections, buns, toast, 3 juices, milk, coffee, and tea. Those with the English plan ate in the first dining area and had many more choices. Typically eating around 8-8:20, there was never a line. After than there could be long ones. The location of this hotel is perfect! It is within walking distance to Russell Square, The British Museum, the Tube, pubs, restaurants, Leicester Square, Covent Garden, Piccadilly Circus, theatres and more. If you're not a walker, it is convenient to hop on a double decker bus, or the Tube. The Night and Day pub/cafe, located in the Imperial Hotel (attached to the President) stays open late for a light meal, a pint, or other drinks. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I didn't expect to rate this hotel based on the standards of another country (USA). "When in Rome......"

Reviews.Title: “For a 3 star hotel it was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: sylik_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 9 hotels which were all 3 stars across Europe. This review is based on the fact it is a 3 star hotel. Pros: The hotel had a very London feel to it. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The room was spacious, clean and everything worked fine. We had no problems with any aspect of the room. The bathroom had adequate space for all your bathroom needs which we found not 3 star rooms have. Location was brilliant only a minute walk to Russell Square station ( great line for many of London's attractions ), Tesco supermarket and a post office. Cons: None of these cons affected our stay, however it would have been nice if these were changed. No Mini fridge, many other 3 star hotels had a mini fridge to hold a few drinks and snacks. Buffet Breakfast was included and was nice but there wasn't as wide a range as many of our other hotels had. Toast, Jam, Rolls and Cereal only. The room wasn't the most modern looking room, however i believe most 3 star hotels in London would be similar. If we were to go back to London we would stay at this hotel again, the location is fantastic, service great and met all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly shabby, but decent for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: Riverdawn
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about hotels, and I'm particularly picky about things like cleanliness, which tends to be a problem with older/slightly shabbier hotel. So when I recently had to stay at the President's Hotel for a family event, I was a bit nervous that I would have issues with the room. I was actually pleasantly surprised. So here's the real picture: The President is definitely on the older side, and yes, a bit shabby. The lobby is a bit sad looking and constantly smells of cigarette smoke, and the some of the receptionists were a bit rude. Also, the wireless internet worked only in some areas - for example, in my room I had to sit on the floor near the front door to have any chance of reception, and even in parts of the lobby you couldn't quite get it. Now, on to the room itself: the design is a bit old fashioned and basic - nothing to write home about. However, the room we stayed in was perfectly clean and in good condition - I didn't get any of the "icky" feeling I get in some hotel rooms. Conveniently (and unlike many hotel rooms) not only were there overhead lights in the bedroom, but there were switches for turning the light on and off near the bed itself, making it very convenient if you like to read before going to bed. Also, because the hotel is on the old side, the rooms were actually much larger than you get in your usual London hotel. They were really quite roomy. The bathroom was a bit on the basic side design wise (old fashioned tub, exposed shower head and a shower curtain), and you should be aware that the hotel DOES NOT SUPPLY SHAMPOO, and the towels are really tiny. However, it was perfectly clean, and there was plenty of hot water and very good water pressure. We did not try the complimentary breakfast, as there are plenty of nice cafes and places to eat nearby, so I can't comment on that. Now, given all of the above, you might be asking yourself "hmm... why would I stay in this okish, but somewhat shabby, hotel?" Well, there are two answers: 1. Location, location, location! The hotel is right around the corner from Russell Square station, which puts it 5 minutes away from the British Museum, 10 minutes away from the British Library, a short walk from Covent Garden and the West End, and on the Piccadilly Line, which is one of London's most convenient Tube lines, especially if you are coming in from Heathrow. Honestly, I can't imagine a much better location than this if you're a tourist in London. 2. Given the outstanding location: the Price. We looked at every other option for a decent hotel in this kind of location, and honestly couldn't find anything that came even close to meeting the price of the President. So, bottom line: If you can afford to spend considerably more money, and/or are really persnickety about having an up-to-date, well designed hotel, go elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a well price deal at an outstanding location, but still want something clean and reasonably pleasant (if shabby) - this is a probably a good pick for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RonzPerth_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We were a little disappointed with this hotel although it was in a good location for the tube station. The rooms were clean but average and quite quiet but there was no shampoo, shower gel or hairdryer in the room, only soap. The bed was comfy enough but had very thin pillows and I had to make a makeshift pillow out of the spare blanket supplied. The full English Breakfast served in the diningroom was of good quality with a good selection of hot food, cereals, fruit segments etc, but only rolls and toast to choose from. The diningroom was quite crowded in the mornings and was a bit like school dinners with most tables arranged in long rows. However, we found the staff pleasant enough and we were able to leave our bags with them for 50p per bag until our late departure in the day. Overall our stay was pleasant enough but hotel could benefit from an overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: millmc1
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel in a very good part of London with the tube station a short walk away, the room could have been cleaner { in our room there was an old used bar of soap on the sink, yuk !!! } The breakfast we found excellent. Overall we had a good over night stay in London. One thing we would recommend is a ride on a Richshaw that was so funny !!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy location, room needed an urgent renovation, very unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: The room apparently hasn't been redecorated for 10 years, the wallpapers partially came off. The mattress was very worn, every single spring could be felt, and one was hanging inside it like in a hammock, but more uncomfy. All night long there where loud humming noises from electric motors, possibly from a ventilation system. At least the bathroom was clean, but a toilet brush was missing, which I consider a very basic and required equipment. The hotel has a 2-class breakfast, and package tour tourists only got the simple breakfast with flabby rolls and warm (!) orange juice. An upgrade to english bf would have cost 6.75 GBP, despite I have paid a lot more (100 EUR) than a reservation "on site" (77 GBP = ca. 90 EUR) including english bf would have cost. Staff was all but helpful, especially was not willing to resolve the breakfast issue. Additionally the hotel is located at a very noisy street and does not have noise protecting windows. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a discounted price, it's worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MasamiLaurie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We were able to book it through a website where we could get a good discount. It's not amazing inside, and the room had zero view, but for the money we paid, and with the hotel's excellent location (2 minutes from the tube) it was definitely a good place to stay. We had the continental breakfast, which is cheaper than the full English. It was good. We were on the 1st floor. The shower lacked power, but the bathroom was quite clean. We were a little hesitant to book this hotel due to a lot of people's reviews on this website stating that the bathroom was not clean. But we did not find this to be the case - the hotel, in general, was fairly clean. It's just a little worn around the edges. If the management could sort the plumbing out in this place it would be much more comfortable though! In conclusion, we had a great time staying here. The location and the price was very good. (The pub between the station and the hotel is also a good place to grab lunch or dinner!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, hotel slightly tired, but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: bigfathairyelephant
Reviews.Content: This is a fab location to explore London by foot, bus or underground. There is a underground one street away, St Pancras Station 10 minutes walk away and a good bus route on the door step.
