The hotel itself is large, a little dated and dark, however i felt the rooms were clean and very serviceable. the ensuites were large enough to move around. i was woken a few times during the night by all the annoying fire exit doors shutting with a loud clunk. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise, it was full enlgish but buffet style and still hot. I have stayed in the sister hotel around the corner as well (Imperial) out of the two i think id stay in the Imperial, purely for the views over Russell Square and further. President was on a side street so we missed out. Overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pete p
Reviews.Content: you couldn't have a better location in London. 2minutes to Russell sq tube station on the Piccadilly line for Heathrow. Great shops, banks, parks and the British museum within 5 minutes walk. The hotel its self is pretty basic, clean, well serviced, and helpfull staff, but our room was a bit tired as appeared the rest on the first floor, the room had a trouser press fitted but an iron would have been a better option, has free wifi but very slow and a lot of dead spots in our room. however takeing into account the price, the location and the fact that the hotel was clean, I feel this is a great hotel for the budget concious, I would stay again next time I'm in London

Reviews.Title: “basic but does excellent job”
Reviews.Author: TIMELORDLeicester
Reviews.Content: very quick check in lovely room on 7th floor overlooking rusell square clean adaequete room breakfast is basic but eatable resturant staff clear tables very quickly largre atrium lounge to sitin would defintly use again

Reviews.Title: “Overnight in London”
Reviews.Author: pollyferg
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through British Airways as a flight and hotel package for a weekend break to London. The hotel was a BA recommednded hotel but unfortunately the standard was very poor. I have stayed in many hotels in London and even though the location was good for West End theatre I would only rate this hotel at best 2*. The noise level at night and having to leave the window open for fresh air did not help! Going for breakfast in the morning was another challenge it reminded me of the school dining room! Dont think we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Plain but really good value”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I need to be in London. All the other recent reviews ring true, but for value this place can't be beaten. The trick to being in London is not to spend much time in your hotel... There's so much else to do. A bed, with all the expected stuff, and a traditional buffet breakfast is all you need from a hotel. Considering an all you can eat breakfast is included in the price you can't complain. Just get down for breakfast before the tourist rush and get out to experience the city and you've got it made.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break in London”
Reviews.Author: Rosmart
Reviews.Content: Generally a tired looking hotel but ideally placed near Russel Sq tube station for all central London amenities. Entrance area regularly smelled 'fishy' which was off putting if you wanted to sit in the reception area. Breakfast was basic and uninspiring (only orange juice available for example i.e. no other choices) along with standard cereal and full english option. Quantity not a problem but quality was lacking. Rooms very much in need of modernisation but contained the usual fittings you would expect although it was a bit stingy on the tea and coffee packs. One very good point was the bed which was (for me) very comfortable and although our view overlooked a rooftop the room was quiet until both guests and staff started slamming doors from around 6.00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Was Enough”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as others have said, is basic. Staff need some people-skills training. Room was simple but clean. Only one pillow. Very noisy (All night !!) with traffic and as no air con you needed to have the window open for some air. No shower gel, shampoo, lotion, etc... One tea bag and one coffee sachet each. No biscuits. Breakfast was not the best. Breakfast room was very busy but there was no one coordinating the service. You just found your own table and most had not been cleared nor prepared. Tea 'stewed' but it was hot. Ennglish breakfast I thought was terrible. Cold bacon, very poor quality tasteless sausages and beans. Cold eggs, cold toast, ........ but there was a plentiful supply. On the plus side the shower was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls very noisy if you have ignorant neighbours.”
Reviews.Author: JJIMMYMAC
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel but was value for money due to its location and ease to get to from Russel Square tube station and only 10/15 min walk from Kings Cross. Rooms were dated but very clean walls are thin so can be noisy, take your own tea & coffee with you as you get 1 teabag & 1 coffee each in the welcome pack also there are no toiletries, iron or hairdryer provided in rooms just soap. Breakfast was ok but was very busy be aware when using dining room for even ing meal as you can be overcharged as we were, the menu is misleading there is a 2 course special at Â£12:50 shown but if you choose from standard menu ie 2 cheaper items you will still be charged the Â£12:50 special price, or maybe Â£35 which was asked for at till by restaurant manager who then corrected it to Â£25 which was still a Â£5 overcharge we had to pay this as he would not listen to us, we witnessed an other couple querying the same.This alone stopped us from using restaurant for the remainder of our stay and perhaps from using this hotel again. Advice & information/directions etc from porters & reception was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “worst food i have ever had in any hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMcCarthy
Reviews.Content: the hotel is central,bit dated and very basic but the breakfastwasthe worst food i have ever come across in any hotel in the world.poor quality food,but plenty of it,well no wonder there then.i was embarrassed to think of the foreign tourists staying there and thinking this was the quality of food typical in britain

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for........”
Reviews.Author: Topcat63
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights bed & breakfast, breakfast was plentiful, well cooked and set us up for the day. Rooms are okay, twin room had two single beds, bedding was changed each day and was crisp & clean. Room is dated as is the bathroom (separate toilet) but more than adequate for our needs, hardly spent any time in the room. The location is perfect, 100 metres from a tibe station, local buses pass the door and a pub and restaurants plus Tesco Express within 100 metres. Hotel can be noisey, and is located near two busy roads, but to be honest we slept well. Staff are very helpful, we required two extra pillows and forgot to ask until 11.30pm, with 5 minutes housekeeping was at our door with the pillows, excelllent service. If you want 5 star standards & 5 star service, you need to pay the price.........otherwise this hotel will suit anyone who wants a good clean basic hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, helpful staff, hotel just a little dated”
Reviews.Author: katie2686
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, just a 2minute walk around the corner from Russel Square Tube station. Check in quick and easy, all I had to do was sign my name. The Key is huge (probably so you leave it at reception when your out sightseeing etc), but there's a drop box for keys and you just need to give your name and room number to recollect the key. I changed room to begin with, since the room I was placed in had a very damp and unpleasant smell. The next room they gave me was fine. Single rooms in this hotel do mean single beds, and the rooms are quite small, but to be honest I didnt spend a great deal of time in the hotel anyway and they're big enough to function even if you have a large suitcase. All the staff were very helpful if you need anything for your room or info regarding attractions etc. Breakfast is included in the price of the room, but somehow I was entitled to english breakfast and my friend had to pay Â£4.50 to upgrade from continental (we both paid the same price for our rooms??!) Floorboards are a bit creaky in the corridors, so if your a light sleeper you might struggle with this hotel. Doors closing can be quite noisy too, and come 7am you'll probably get woken up with the noise of other guests leaving their rooms and walking to the lifts. overall, a nice little hotel in an excellent location. there's even a little shopping street by the tube station with a few restaurants and a tesco express should you wish to buy something cheap for your lunch/snacks etc.

Reviews.Title: “More bad than good”
Reviews.Author: Leonid S
Reviews.Content: Bad: - free Internet they are offering is not working, either very slow or can't connect. Useless. - old tv, about 2-3 channels only. Useless. - first room got broken bath, got another smaller room instead. - looks like no AC in room, smell from restaurant on first floor going inside if windows are open. - lots of people everywhere, elevators or restaurant for breakfast, lines! - with open windows you could bring lots of noise into room Good: - porters are friendly but very low in knowledge, even worse with housekeeping. - location.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jeffy12
Reviews.Content: stayed in 263 our only complaint is that mattress was in need of replacement. The hotel is in a good location within walkind distance to the west end and covent garden and has excellent pubs with good food really close by.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT I WOULD PAY MORE FOR BETTER HOTEL IN FUTURE”
Reviews.Author: 574Walkies
Reviews.Content: Walked to hotel from Euston station as only about a 10-15 minute walk so no problem there. Check in was efficient and professional, staff I dealt with were always helpful and polite. We (1 adult and two children) were on the fifth floor facing Russell Square, very noisy and even with the secondary double glazing I found it difficult to sleep. The room was pretty small with twin beds and a camp bed which we had to ring down to reception to open up as I was unable to work out how to do it. To be fair to housekeeping, a lady appeared within 20 minutes of our call to reception and rectified the problem. Grotty, dated and tired decor in the bedroom but the bathroom had been refurbished and was the best part of the room. Both bathroom and bedroom were clean. Breakfast was OK, bacon appeared broiled rather than fried, all eggs appeared overcooked and the toast was thin sliced which is a first anywhere for me. It was adequate but nothing special. One thing that impressed me was that each piece of luggage you did not want to traipse around London you could leave at the hotel and it only cost 50p per item. That has to be a bargain in London especially when you consider it is Â£8.50 at Euston station.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericaj27
Reviews.Content: Good location but. Really small rooms and way too much disturrbance-very difficult to get. Any sleep at all

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: opiEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a short break in August. Hotel is a bit dated with tired decor, but the staff were very helpful and the room clean. Towels and sheets were changed daily, and the breakfast was of good quality. Excellent location just around the corner from Russell Square tube station. Good pub opposite (Friend in the Hand). Only one niggle - some very loud and ignorant guests in the room next door on our last night meant we couldn't get to sleep until after 2.30am. Ideal budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Fish S
Reviews.Content: In Novemeber 2010 5 of us departed to London from Liverpool. All was well until we arrived to an awful building until we realised it was the vile President Hotel. Shocked, we stepped into the hotel and caught a sudden scaring stench of fish. At first, we thought that this was only 'dinner' but after we had arrived back at the hotel at night we found out that this would be a permanent stench. One of us had to sleep on a sponge matress on the floor-it looked very unappealing. The quilt she had to use stunk of fish (again!) and was itchy. To add to this in our en-suite smoke was coming through the filthy tiles because one of your other guests were smoking. (Have the decensy to air freshen the room). In the morning, we were looking forward to a tasty breakfeast. This dream was soon to be shattered when we were introduced to the unclean cuttelry and plates. The cereal stalls made us feel very unimpressed by the bland choice and the leftover cereal and other unimaginable bits (crumbs) left on the bottom of the containers. We had planned to go and see a West End show-Wicked. One of the desk employees promised us an on time taxi and recomeneded we only left 10mins early. However when the time came he was unaware of the taxi shedule and busy streets in London. In the end, we misssed the first half of the performance thanks to the unorganised staff. This made us feel very upset and depressed. Even the two children were crying. Overall, we were glad to leave the fishy smell behind. We HIGHLY don't recomend this hotel to anyone looking to stay at hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for London, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Stuart B
Reviews.Content: Very dated with small, shabby rooms. At least they are clean. No bath, just a shower and no toiletries. You can get much, much better around Russell Square for only Â£10-Â£15 extra per night. It's definitely worth paying that extra to get somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “We would use it again”
Reviews.Author: gemini187047
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the president and the hotel was alright, a good location the breakfast was really good and the staff were pleasant and helpful. We would use it again

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ironhips
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a Superbreak theatre trip. Was a bit worried after seeing some reviewsof this hotel. We arrived and were booked in at reception very pleasant staff. Room 335 was ready perfectly acceptable clean, nice bathroom may have just been refurbished but no problems at all. The secondary glazing kept any street noise down to a minimum so no problem sleeping. Breakfast pleny of choice but very busy when we went in at 8am Later went much quieter. All in all very satisfied no noise from other rooms but a very busy hotel, I would definitely go ther again for a short London Break. We asked for a quiet room when booking do not know if this worked or we were just lucky

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul s
Reviews.Content: All staff very polite, helpful and made our stay enjoyable. Breakfast was good and plenty of it. The room was clean and tidy with fresh bedding and towels daily. A fabulous place to eat other than the hotel is The Friend At Hand pub across the road in Herbrand Street. A fantastic hotel

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: newlife7262
Reviews.Content: Overall a really good value for money hotel and very well situated. We took advantage of the free dinner when you stay two nights, but frankly the food was truly awful and breakfast was very poor too. Compared Â£ for Â£ with other budget hotels and it was acceptable, you really do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fab time!”
Reviews.Author: TeamCochrane
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this hotel as the website makes it look very old and tired but we were pleasantly surprised! The room was very clean and the extra bed for a child was already made when we arrived. Our room faced the back of the hotel which wasn't the prettiest view but we'd rather have that than a possibly noisy street view. Our housekeeper was lovely and when we couldn't work out how to unfold the bed the next night, was there in 2 mins to do it for us! Everyone very friendly and pleasant. Breakfast was not the selection we were used to elsewhere but certainly enough to start you off for the day and plenty of eateries nearby if you want something more to choose from. Only downside to the hotel was the Saracen carvery which we had on the first night. Our little one only had some cold meat and salad on a side dish but was charged full adult price as they had no childrens option available. Not much choice of meats and everyone had same veg and roast? potatoes whether they liked them or not. Had to ask for a drinks order to be taken which took ages to come and was wrong when it did. The waiters blamed the fact that it was Ramadan and that they were all struggling to cope. I sympothise but it was very hot and all we wanted was water! Apart from this it was very good and would definately use again - just would eat out for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently situated but dated, dirty and breakfast room was chaotic”
Reviews.Author: HASTOBEHOT
Reviews.Content: The reception were ok with us, but then we had very little to do with them. The rooms are very dated and not very clean, I wiped the top of the bedside table with a wipe and so much muck came off it!! . A member of staff opened our door and walked in after we had just checked in and got into our room. She did apologise but don' they check these things before just barging in ?? she didn't even knock first! It is very convenient and safe area, but just not clean enough. It so needs a refurb. Breakfast was basic eggs were hard. Again everything felt 'tacky' . Dirty cutlery etc . Just as well we were out most of the time and too tired to make any fuss. Wouldn't go back again. Oh beds are very hard (well ours was)

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient. bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Duncan014
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for Bed and Breakfast. I had an excellent spacious single room. The breakfast was toally self service andquick.The food was good. and adequate for me but one could eat as much as required. I liked the bar at night. It had no T.V. no machines of any kind, the prices were cheap for London and one could have a drink in peace. The room was excellent, comfortable bed and good shower. Plenty of towels and cupboard and drawer space

Reviews.Title: “Good location for central London attractions.”
Reviews.Author: YorkhireJean
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a fancy hotel but our room was clean and comfortable. It wasn't noisy despite being busy and you could open the windows! It was a good location for many attractions, five minutes from Russell Square tube station,and about 15 mins from Kings Cross. We walked to many places once we'd got our bearings. I found the reception staff to be most helpful and you coud leave your luggage on departure day for 50p per bag. On the downside, the breakfast could do with an overhaul, OK but not that appetising.

Reviews.Title: “nice and central”
Reviews.Author: BishopSuzywong
Reviews.Content: been to president for the last five years. basic but nice and clean. breakfasts lovely nice back bacon. just a nice stroll to covent gardens and embankment. hope to go next year but will have to see what price is with the games been on.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't try to be something it's not.”
Reviews.Author: galali
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, small and got very hot in summer but you spend very little time in it so more than adequate. The atrium lounge is relaxing after a long day sight-seeing. Night and day bar which is connected has tasty pub grub and prices for food and drink reasonable. The staff are very helpful and we appreciated the help getting a taxi. We purchased vouchers at Â£10 each for the Bannantynes health club as the day was very hot and fancied a swim. This is next to London National Hotel, for this price you can use the gym, steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and pool as long as you like (we were there for 3 hrs and no one said to go). The pool is not deep which is great for kids or not so strong swimmers. The open top bus tour which you can catch round the corner is great to see the sights and purchase a two day ticket for about Â£7 extra it's worth it. Legally blonde show great fun and plenty of places to eat close by. My daughter and I had a great time in London and would return to The president, breakfast hearty and most things a short bus ride or tube away. Thank-you trip advisor as reviews really helpfull before going and can't wait to return to London and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location with avarage room and service”
Reviews.Author: Pleura3
Reviews.Content: me and my wife spent 2 night at president hotel, the toilet, room ,bed sheets and carpet were clean, but there was no frig in the room and the TV was so small and the key was funny(long metal rod about 30 cm) overall we didn't spend time in the room apart from sleeping, the breakfast buffet was ok (English breakfast), the great thing about this hotel is its near by the Russell Square metro station only 2 min walk and also there is Tesco supermarket in front of the station so you can buy whatever you need, our stay was good and i might think of staying there again if i couldn't get better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Peerfectly adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindaloulou
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly adequate hotel for a few nights stay in London. Very good position, walking distance from Kings Cross, St Pancras and Euston stations, and also within walking distance of many theatres and attractions, so saving on transport costs. Clean room, decent beds, good bathroom. English buffet breakfast was ample, with enough choice for most, and special offer of a free evening meal on the first night if two or more nights booked was very welcome. Just a couple of criticisms 1) There is no hairdryer in the bedrooms, but one can be obtained from housekeeping after paying a deposit. This is a bit of a pain - surely a hairdryer should be standard nowadays? 2) The only toiletry provided is soap - so remember to bring your own shampoo and shower gel. 3) Only sweetners, not sugar, provided at breakfast. These are only minor points, and would not deter me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel -- not top class but clean enough”
Reviews.Author: ashuc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel along with our teenage kids for 5 night and had two rooms which were interconnected. Clean hotel. The resturant staff was very pleasent and helpful. The hot breakfast was decent enough but the same fare every single day. The hotel is right next to the Subway so great connectivity has a pub right opposite so can get awee bit noisy at night but fair enough. The TV in the room is a small 14 inch one though. Bathroom are fairly small. But as we came back to thehotel only to sleep really it did not matter.

Reviews.Title: “Good London 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: oakworth
Reviews.Content: Good location for us, clean and tidy, breakfast fine, not too much noise, no frills, service fine all in all for a London Hotel I thought it was very good. Will stay there again. We had a 3 night package with double room and train fares from Yorkshire for about Â£325.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: BoroRach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner during summer half term. We had previously stayed at the Royal National, part of the same chain, and weren't overly impressed. We paid extra to be upgraded to the President. Yes it is very dated and could do with a thorough refurbishment. Our room was basic but clean with a lovely view over Russell Square. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The food was nothing special but was tasty and plentiful. It is right around the corner from the tube station which is a welcome relief after a long day sightseeing. Make sure you buy an oyster card in advance so that you can avoid the often huuuuuuge queues at the ticket machines. This hotel doesn't pretend to be luxurious and it isn't. If you'd like somewhere clean and comfortable to sleep with a decent breakfast in a central location then you won't go far wrong with a stay at te President. I'll be staying there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased again”
Reviews.Author: MaryGrace2
Reviews.Content: Once again the President has provided me with clean, comfortable, safe and reasonably priced accommodation. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Price was good but a poor standard”
Reviews.Author: DCM1a
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there 2 nights as our visit was only to catch up on some theatre shows The hotel was central and the bedroom appeared,although lacking in amenities,clean enough. Because of the price it was a busy hotel and had we not been out most of the time would not have chosen to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: debanderson90808
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a long weekend trip and were very disappointed. Even though the hotel is old and in need of repair, the housekeeping is horrible. One nite I pulled back the bedspread to find that the maid changed the sheets with dirty sheets and pillow case! It was disgusting. I had also left a note asking for fresh wash clothes because the ones they originally gave us were also soiled and placed the old ones on the floor. They placed the ones on the floor back on the tub and did not give us new ones. The reason I had to leave a note was because the front desk would not talk to housekeeping for me and because I was leaving the hotel for the day before housekeeping started working, I had to leave the note. The continental breakfast is not a typical european continental breakfast where there is typically meats and cheese and often yogurt or hard boiled eggs. Instead it is cereal, poor choice of fruit, rolls and toast that is already made. Do yourself a favor and get the hot breakfast with the room instead. The front desk staff were not friendly - the younger bell hops were helpful though with directions and other information.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but does the job”
Reviews.Author: mattnchar
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with our stay at the President Hotel on the 30th June. The Hotel is basic and in need of modernisation but the reality is that it serves a purpose in providing budget accommodation in Central London at a reasonable rate. The tube station is only a matter of steps away enabling guests simple access to the underground network. I think that many people have the wrong perception of properties like this. If you are looking for a 4 or 5 star property, source one! The President is an ideal base for tourists and business professionals alike and if you go with that view, you won't be disappointed. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was adequate, so we had no complaints whatsoever. If I was being really picky, there was a bit of early morning noise but you are in a Central location so perhaps not totally unexpected. I have no doubts that this hotel will fall short of some peoples expectation levels but perhaps in some cases they are unrealistic ones.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, excellent value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: davealiSomerset
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the President as a package deal including theatre tickets to see We Will Rock You - booked through Travel Lodge. Must say after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor prior to our leaving home I was very worried about the hotel, but am glad to say that on arrival the reviews I had read were totally different to the President Hotel I was staying in! The lobby is large - plenty of staff on the desk - all of whom we spoke to were very, very helpful. Breakfast was sufficient - cooked breakfast, cereals, toast, tea, coffee and juice - what more do you need?! As to the room it was very acceptable, very clean double bed, new carpet in room excellent shower over the bath with loads of hot water and a very good spray from the shower head. Hair dryer in the room - new vanity unit - the only thing we didn't like was the very bright light above the bed. As to the view outside the window we overlooked the glass roof of the lounge below - which whilst not the best view in London - I did not need to stare out of the window at any time during my stay! Towels were not the best - but they were clean and we had three for the two of us - more than enough. Only soap in the bathroom - but hey I always take my own anyway so can't see the problem some people had on that score. We were on the 2nd floor which had a very large bright corridor. Stay here for excellent value in the centre of London - excellent location for theatres, Covent Garden etc. didn't use the tube once as everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated building”
Reviews.Author: Suzie1wong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my 30th birthday from the 1st to the 3rd July. Having read the reviews I was to say a little nervous!we arrived early at 11 instead of 2 and waited at reception to be told we had to cone back at 2 but could leave our bags,so we joined the huge que to leave them! When we got back at 2 the que for check in was massive!we waited 15 minutes to be seen,by very unhappy reception staff! We got our room which was on the 6th floor on the corner above a Chinease!the smell was awful,our room was clean but dated and the air con did not work,so we left the windows open all day and night. The shower kept clogging up as well so that wasn't good,our tv only worked when u turned light on not the tv button!! The towels were paper thin and the beds were uncomfortable!we were woke at 6.30 am the first night by the cleaners banging doors and knocking to see if people were up!I got up and put the do not disturb sign on our door! Breakfast was full English that we had paid for and was average,the room was very busy and it was difficult to get a seat! Second night we were woke by the man next door with his blaring tv so I knocked and asked him to turn it down!he did!we were once again woke at 6.30 with the cleaners!! If you want an ideal location and are not to bothered about the room it's ideal!if not don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel”
Reviews.Author: Jowallace1974
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. I often visit London for weekend theatre, music or sport breaks. This package was booked through Superbreak and was the only hotel on offer. We arrived and the reception smelt very musty and dated, the check in staff were very polite and spoke English. The twin room was very basic, but clean so was the bathroom. However the towels were stained and discoloured. The bed was extreamly uncomfortable and I could feel the springs in the mattress. No aircon in the room so we had to leave the window open, I hope that this is the reason for the 7 bites on my body and not that the bed had unwanted visitors. At 7am the cleaners started on the rooms and the slamming of doors was unbearable!!! Breakfast was buffet style and was of very poor quality and cold. Coffee was rancid!!!!! Was down early so we did not have to wait, however by 8.15 the queue was very long and people were begining to complain. On the plus side the location is fantastic, close to the tube station and you would never lose your room key!!!!. If you are booking a package deal, make sure you are not paying over the top for this hotel and if you intend to book direct...... Save your money and stay at the travel lodge in Covent Garden, it may be basic but is still better than the President and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “â€˜Britishâ€™ Hospitality at its worst!”
Reviews.Author: Puffin2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the 2011 Wimbledon Tennis Championships. A wonderful trip, apart from our accommodation at the President Hotel in London. An outdated, dirty and noisy hotel with unhelpful, disinterested reception staff with NO clue about customer care. A dirty, dilapidated corridor led to our fluorescent-lit bedroom and moldy bathroom. Tea and coffee-making facilities were provided in the room. Soap and two small hand towels were provided, but no shampoo. I had noted when booking the hotel that hairdryers were not supplied in the room, but that on payment of a â€˜smallâ€™ refundable deposit, a hairdryer could be provided. On arrival, I requested a hairdryer and was asked to pay a deposit of Â£20 which I was informed had to be cash. I did this and was presented with a receipt and asked to return the hairdryer on departure for my refund. I dutifully returned the hairdryer (which was covered in Property of President Hotel stickers) when checking out, only to be told by an extremely unhelpful hotel receptionist that, as I didnâ€™t have the receipt, my Â£20 could not be refunded. Despite 20 minutes searching bags, room and bins looking for the lost receipt, and a further 20 minutes in discussion, suggesting the hotel could check the counterfoil they had retained of my receipt, followed by requesting to see the manager and expressing our disbelief about the poor level of service, the hotel steadfastly refused to return the deposit, but said we could keep the hairdryer!!! We were stunned by this unbelievable lack of customer care and expressed this to the hotel staff who said the manager would be arriving in a few hours if we'd like to wait!!! If you want to have an enjoyable holiday in London, I strongly recommend you do not stay in this hotel. I was actually embarrassed for the many foreign tourists in the hotel, experiencing â€˜Britishâ€™ hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GREAT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth186220
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a short weekend break. Good location but badly in need of an update. The rooms were very basic, paper peeling off the wall, mould on the ceiling, really worn carpets, reminded me of a hall of residence. But.. the beds looked clean, the breakfast was OK, and lets face it, staying in London you dont spend much time in the room.Definetely would not stay here again, but if youve already booked ...its OK ? just dont expect too much !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lynzigreenall
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay here as part of a super breaks deal. When staying in London I have always stayed at the islington Hilton so was nut sure what to expect after reading the reviews. The rooms were small but very clean and were cleaned every day. Staff friendly and helpfull for directions. The location was brilliant!! 30 seconds from the tube on the picadilly line, 1 stop from kings cross! Right next to the British history museum, Coventry garden 10 mins walk. I was pleasantly surprised!! This hotel is no Hilton but it doesn't pretend to be and certainly doesn't match the price. We stayed 3 nights bed and english breakfast. Morning were very busy, best to wait to be seated as different parts of the room have different breakfasts. Breakfast was cereal. Fruit. Bread. Bacon, eggs, beans, toast with tea coffee. Average but fine. Overall we would stay here again for a central cheap hotel. It's not for a romantic break but great for weekend of sight seeing :-D

Reviews.Title: “great for those on budget”
Reviews.Author: ruthie2301
Reviews.Content: Me my friend and her 7 year old daughter booked here through Superbreaks,, was apprehensive after reading some of the reviews.. But seriously, I thought the hotel was clean and comfortable, the decor is a little dated, but do you really care as long as its clean. I thought all the staff were very polite and helpful,, they all work very hard. The breakfast was fine, but recommend going before 8ish if you don't want to queue. I would recommend this is on a budget, near tubes, although we never used them. The people who left bad reviews obviously want luxury for pennies. A little noisy if your facing Russell sq,, but after trapesing around London, you'll prob be too tired to care.Yep I would recommend, unless you are fussy...ideal base hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but perfectly ok”
Reviews.Author: Andy_and_Michelle_10
Reviews.Content: Stopped two nights 21 and 22 June 2011. The hotel is convenient for Russell Square Tube and within a walkable distance of King's Cross. We had room 660 which was clean and quiet. There was TV, kettle, trouser press. The bathroom was spotless but had only soap, no shower gel or shampoo. English breakfast was fine, and we found no queues, however we arrived before 8am both mornings - late risers may find differently. We found the staff to be pleasant and would have no problem going back. The point for me is that its a budget hotel : don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star hotel and not value for money”
Reviews.Author: ro45li
Reviews.Content: One good point; location! Just around the corner of the tube station and walking distance to the theater-land (Strand, Covent Garden etc). But that is all! This is a place without an official rating (The family chain of 6 hotels have rated their hotels to be 'similar' to the official rating system, according to the reception staff!) And I get the feeling this rating is not entirely neutral nor objective! My room (single) was very simple, without minibar or other facilities. The curtains were not adequate to keep light out and the walls were stained and sooty from lamps and radiators. Bed-springs were protruding from the mattress. Not even shampoo was available in the flimsy plastic shower-cabinet. I was unlucky and got one of the smallest rooms on the 7th floor. This floor is obviously an later extension to the hotel and the 78 rooms on the 7th floor is served by one lift only, that in addition was out of order for the most of the week. Paying rack-price for a single room on the 7the floor is not a good deal, indeed! I inquired at the reception about the possibility of getting a room on a lower floor, that had somewhat larger rooms but they were not responsive at all. They claimed all rooms were the same - thereby grossly insulting my intelligence. I got the feeling of being a commodity, not a guest. The common parts are tired and worn, wallpaper hanging loose from several places, carpets are soiled etc. The place is in a desperate need of refurbishment and solid spring cleaning! With all the hundreds of hotel-alternatives in the central part of London, I suggest you avoid this chain of hotels linked to Imperial London hotels as they unfortunately can not be judges to give value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable no frills hotel in very convenient London area”
Reviews.Author: Safaria
Reviews.Content: It is almost ten years since I last stayed at this hotel in London. It was quite low down on my list of hotels for a last minute business trip to London but all the hotels at the top of my list were fully booked. I found that since my previous stay some parts have been refurbished and the staff were particularly pleasant this time around. I stayed on the top floor and was pleased that on a warm evening the window opened - not always the case in some London hotels even some better ones! - and there was a bit of a rooftop outlook. A basic no frills room but clean, neat and with a spotless shower room with soap (not always provided in some hotels) etc. I booked via an agent - the only one that was able to offer a room at the hotel at a time when all local hotels seemed to be already booked up and all other agents said this one was as well so I expected that I would be allocated some sort of broom cupbard type option :-). Instead two single beds in a smallish room with a slightly creaky floor but with teh usual TV, kettle and coffee/tea provided. The price advertised on the hotel desk was a little less than I had pre-paid but then my online booking had said breakfast NOT included whereas the hotel DID provide me with a full English breakfast. The breakfast was the usual self service options that this level of hotels provides. This hotel still provides room keys - as opposed to the more common swipe cards - and the key was on a long metal stick. Though the key worked when I first arrived, the next morning after breakfast I could not unlock the door and had to obtain help from the porter's desk. I gather that I was not the first cleint to experience difficulty with the room lock. The help provided fixed the problem and I was on my way again. The main advantage of this hotel is that it is literally a corner away from Russel Square Tube station down a short narrow street. As a solo traveller who often has to return to the hotel at night I appreciate not having to walk far from public transport. While I would still not put this hotel much further up on my preference list, as a business traveller I would not hesitate to stay there again for an overnight stay if my first and favourite choices were not available.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy19
Reviews.Content: Trip booked as part of a theatre package through Thomas Cook - to celebrate daughters 21st birthday. A family trip, taking 2 rooms; one double, one twin. Room sizes reasonable, with basic hotel provision (t&c, TV etc). Generally clean though bathroom ventilation poor resulting in black roof mould which was worse in the twin room. We also had issue accessing the room with a dodgy lock; we had to get the room porters to open the door on 3 separate occasions - particularly frustrating. Service at breakfast very poor. Wait for table was nearly 20 minutes; surly attitude of staff member showing us to a table which wasn't prepared for use. Food was not particularly appetising, was tasteless and frankly of poor standard. Beware the juice machine; we noted a member of staff emptying the tray slops into a glass pitcher which they left to the side of the machine - customers (including ourselves) used this juice thinking it was available when in reality it should have been poured down the drain. Clearance of used plates etc was slow and there were no clean cups available for T&Cs. Generally hotel felt old and tired. If you want basic accomodation without the frills and finishing touches this wil be ok for you - just be aware if your expectations are high. We wouldn't recomend and won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “dingy”
Reviews.Author: colin186402
Reviews.Content: Booked a single bed for 2 nights and was allocated a twin room which was a good size for one person. The bed was very clean as was the bathroom, but the decor was depressingly grubby and in desperate need of redecoration. The cooked breakfast looked badly cooked and very unappetising so gave it a miss. The rolls were stale and the toast underdone and soggy. The whole Hotel appeared dingy but in a good location and the staff friendly. If all you want is a clean bed to rest your head for a night and nothing else then this is OK for the price but I would not recommend a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like stepping into a 1970s nightmare... Terrible”
Reviews.Author: tell-it-as-it-is47
Reviews.Content: What can I say....? First of all I was embarrassed to be English. What must the foreign guests think of England (especially as they may have come through Heathrow)? I travel quite a bit but this is by far the worst hotel I have been to for some time. Why, it was dark and had not been decorated since 1970. I donâ€™t think it has been thoroughly cleaned too many times in that space of time. The room was small. The furniture was tired and old. The TV had various covers missing and was huge. The bed was the least supportive mattress I have ever slept on. So flimsy that when you sat on the bed it shifted off the base of the bed! It was also about one foot too short for me! The bathroom was clean but also very tired and small. Breakfast was very poor. Cheap sausages, fatty bacon, the eggs were tasteless, they ran out of juice and the coffee was truly terrible. Donâ€™t waste your money. I ended up going to Starbucks around the corner. Also, they give you a key on a huge key ring which means you are required to leave it at reception when you leave the hotel. OK you might think? The problem was when I got back they gave me the key to the wrong room... The only good thing was the location, easy walking distance to many parts of London. Please do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jjnede
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good position regarding the tube station as it's just around the corner. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay, the rooms were clean and adequate, we didn't find the traffic outside very noisy at all. The breakfast was ok but the service was good. Wifi worked in our room. Would definately stay here again. It made our weekend very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Iwise
Reviews.Content: The location and its closeness to the tube was very good, but, I was disappointed in the overall value of the hotel. The room & bathroom were clean although the room was a wee bit small. The breakfast was terrible. The bread/toast was from white bread, which was lacking in quantity and we had to wait too long till a new batch was brought. The rolls, both white and wholemeal were tasteless. The English breakfast was without a single piece of cheese and absolutely no fresh vegetables at all were to be had. Basics like Granola & yogurts did not exist. Hard poached eggs and greasy sausage, bacon & beans were once upon a time the English breakfast of the past. They need to rethink their breakfast menu. !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: Steambuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from Russell Square Underground station. Staff were all very helpful and room clean and tidy although the hotel does look somewhat jaded. On the days that we stayed, the hotel was very busy and breakfast arrangements were a bit of a scrum as most people seemed to be on a bed and breakfast arrangement. The staff in the restaurant did their best and the kitchen managed to provide hot food of reasonable quality clearing the long queues quickly. The reception staff appeared very pleasant and efficient and porters were also very helpful and polite. The room staff were very pleasant and prompt at cleaning and re-provisioning. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but average”
Reviews.Author: ca87
Reviews.Content: The placement of the hotel is fine. Close to a metro so you can easily get around London, and getting home at night isn't a problem either. Furthermore, it is right next to a lovely little park, so in case the weather is good that's a fantastic place to sit and drink coffee. The rooms are average - Small but clean and comfortable. if you're planning on spending a lot of time at the hotel I would suggest finding another place. The breakfast isn't anything to talk about - not a lot of seats and tables so get there in time. I would probably not go back.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay here if u paid me!”
Reviews.Author: kojones
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allowed to put our luggage in our room as we arrived early. We were given a HUGE metal stick with our room key attached and was told to hand it in everytime we go out. The room was small and basic and very shabby. Breakfast the next morning was awful. Eggs looked hard and toast was hardly done and cold. worst buffet breakfast I've ever had! Don't book here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: CphKreis
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff, young englisch girls, in the reception was rude when we arrived. The maid on our floor, was sweet and helpfull. The beds are very short =175/180 centimeters. If you have breakfasts included, it is just not the English breakfast, you have to pay 4,5 Pound every day - if you want other stuff than very poor toast bread. And there is no cheese or ham etc. It's a waste of money. The Internet wi-fire doesnâ€™t work at all in your room. If you want to leave luggage the day you checkout, you also have to pay for each item. This is not a 3 star hotel: It's old and and monyemaker!

Reviews.Title: “Good for theatre break”
Reviews.Author: dellybellyChesham
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here on short break. Our room was very clean and ideal for what we wanted. Breakfast was great, plenty of hot food, cereal, fruit juice etc so you could fill up for the day. Coffee in the Atrium very reasonably priced at Â£1.30 and drinks in the 2 bars also not a rip off. Within walking distance of Theatres, Covent Garden, and Embankment this hotel is in a great location and would stay again on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Tolerably mediocre for those on a budget. But you can do better for the same.”
Reviews.Author: RapidAssistant
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews I really wanted to avoid making mine sound like a rant, but here goesâ€¦.I ended up in this hotel due to a Superbreak weekend package deal (foolishly I skimped on the hotel choice in favour of upgrading to 1st Class on the train â€“ big mistake!) The President is in a really central location off Russell Square in Bloomsbury; a short walk from Kingâ€™s Cross/St Pancras or the West End, so you donâ€™t really have to use the Underground all that much if you are staying in this area. Annoyingly, our key was not a modern swipe card, but a keyring with a foot-long chrome rod attached to it, which realistically had to be handed in at the concierge and recollected later â€“ which speaks volumes about the distrust with which they treat their customers. The room was OK â€“ clean enough with a newish looking carpet, and the bathroom had recently been retiled. The bed was an old fashioned divan thing that looked dated, as did most of the furniture. But it WAS somewhere to lay your head at the end of the day. It lost marks for the shower which seemed to be powered by a Karcher pressure washer, and required an awful lot of twiddling of the bath taps to get a decent temperature. The towels were wafer thin and looked like theyâ€™d been washed into oblivion, the complimentary toiletries â€“ well â€“ make sure you bring your own to be honest. No hairdryer, yet strangely there was the ubiquitous Corby trouser press. Whilst the foyer is welcoming, the 4th Floor corridor I was on was very scruffy and generally in need of TLC â€“ it reminded me of a 1960s student hall of residence (thatâ€™s being polite) â€“ with yellowed walls, peeling wallpaper, scuffed woodwork everywhere and a carpet that was probably there since the hotel was built all those decades ago. Noise is an issue. OK it IS the centre of London, and itâ€™s hardly the hotelâ€™s fault â€“ but if you end on up the Russell Square/Southampton Row side of the building be prepared for the late night soundtrack of sirens, drunk people shouting, construction machines, not to mention imbeciles on high powered motorbikes using Southampton Row as a drag strip in the early hours of the morning. My experience wasnâ€™t helped by the gang of children in an adjacent room shouting out the window, who also pinched my â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign - which incidentally is hung from a protruding hook on the door. The piece de la resistance of my stay had to be when taking a shower I got a stroppy phone call from reception to say that the smoke alarm in my room had been triggered, and I should have kept the door shut. Fine if there had been a sign (like in a Premier Inn) to warn me of this, but there wasnâ€™t. To add insult to injury a manager was promptly sent up to our room, who barged his way in to open the windows whilst I was still sitting naked on the bed drying myself!!!!! He then uttered some tosh about â€œso have you been having a party hereâ€� and â€œhave you been smokingâ€�?? The people in the room next door clearly had been â€“ there were cigarette ends jammed into the lintel beneath the window sill. But overall this sort of treatment was utterly unacceptable, something which I will be taking up with the company directly. After reading the other reviews about the appaling breakfast service I stayed away as soon as I saw the massive morning queue for the dining room. Luckily as a seasoned occasional Londoner I know a few nice â€˜greasy spoonâ€™ cafes in the surrounding streets which offer a pretty good English breakfast for less than a fiver. The vast majority of people staying in this hotel (and its three brethren The Royal National, the Imperial and the Bedford owned by the same company) are school trip parties, coach parties and people on package holiday deals so they are never exposed to the headline rate which is Â£112 per night. Looked at it this way, there are at least a dozen Premier Inns, Travelodges and iBISâ€™s within a half mile radius with a far more consistent, more modern experience overall, at the very most for the same amount, and usually less. The bottom line is, if you get put in here as part of a package deal â€“ then itâ€™s a tolerable place to lay your head for the night â€“ think of it as the Ryanair of central London hotels â€“ cheap, but be prepared to make lots of compromises. If you are the type of person for whom the hotel is an integral part of the holiday then you will be bitterly disappointed. My advice is that if you are making all your arrangements yourself, there are far, far superior big name establishments in the vicinity for the same sort of money.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it is- the sister hotel is way better!”
Reviews.Author: Kizzyswizzy
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend visit staying at the President Bed & Breakfast only. It gave us a place to lay our head for the night but that's about the only thing going for it. The breakfast was awful (buffet style) but it looked like it had been there for days and the dining room staff, a couple of whom who had hygiene issues, would take your plate halfway through you eating it (Probably for the best really), however they didn't even ask if you were finished....bad manners! One other thing that bothered me was that the bathroom was dirty and moldy. My partner and I went for late night drinks to the Imperial next door which seemed a lot nicer but I don't think I would take the risk of staying there thanks to my experience at The President.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options for the price”
Reviews.Author: clearset
Reviews.Content: On check-in we were informed that they were unable to find the key to our allocated room, so we were given another room. The room trapped all the drunken noises from the street. Don't believe we had wifi in our room. The ensuite was large and built to take disabled guests. The decor is tired and cleanliness just OK. Basic room not unlike 50's boarding school. Breakfast was unpleasant if you mistimed with the hoards queuing up to get in. It was doubly unpleasant as one of the staff challenged you if you bought the English breakfast but ate in the Continental breakfast room. Location is great but it's not the only hotel in Russell Square. Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Deborah008
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel but it is clean and very close to everything. Just around the corner from the Russell Square tube stop and a short walk to the British Museum which is the #1 tourist attraction in London. The continental breakfast was satisfying - good coffee with toast, fruit, juice and cereal. The first night we were in a very noisy room right beside the main road and Russell Square so we asked to be moved to the other side of the hotel. Much quieter. Beds are comfortable and showers are very good. Great pubs and restaurants nearby. No shampoo, body lotion, shower caps etc. so take your own or buy when you get there. We've stayed here twice and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for central London!”
Reviews.Author: NZGW
Reviews.Content: The only "not so good" about this hotel was the size of the room...quite small...but everything was good for the money I've paid! Good location close to the tube and walkable. Breakfast was extremely yummy and plentiful! Staff were very friendly and helpful! The room keys and elevators are cute (old-fashioned)...The room was very clean! Once you closed the window the room became pretty quiet...WIFI was fast and accessible from the room! (whereas many other hotels is only accessible from the lobby area) What else can I say? I'm definitely coming back to this hotel next time when I visit London (after several comparisons with other local hotels)!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: pman47
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was sparse to say the least with SMALL beds that were the perfect size for a 10 year old that were covered with a blanket that had been washed into oblivion, I hope. the room had no hair dryer and none of the usual amenities as; shampoo, conditioner or lotion. In addition the room was facing the street and the outer windows wouldn't close so the street noises made it extremely noisy. The breakfast was a joke and the service was horrible. Did you also know that your room key was given to you on a 12 inch metal rod that had to been turned in at the desk when you left the hotel and picked up when you return. There was no wifi and there were no facilities to get your boarding pass printed even if you ask the front desk to do it for you.London is wonderful this hotel is not.

Reviews.Title: “Average London Hotel - Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: TheZacks
Reviews.Content: Arrived in London n 6:25 red-eye and went straight to hotel. While room was expectedly not ready yet, allowed for luggage to be stowed. We went off on planned visit to British Museum, which was easy walking distance, and come back about an hour later, exhausted. After waiting for less than 30 minutes, room was made ready. Don't expect luxury here. Just the basics. Maybe a little bigger than the typical budget London hotel, but not by much. Negatives: sparse funishings, very firm bed, limited tv offerrings, poor free breakfast, no wi-fi in room as advertised. Positives: location, easy access to attractions via underground. Centrally located. Courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Carolandgeoff_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the president hotel. After reading some of the reviews i was a little worried about going. How wrong can you be . The staff on arrival were helpfull and friendly, we arrived at 9am to leave our case but were given a room straight away.The room was clean and the en suite spotless There were plenty of drawers and wardrobe space and a hairdrier in the room. we had a meal in the hotel before going to a show. The staff were very good and the carvery was lovely . The meat was not dried out or over cooked. Everything else was hot and well presented.It was very good value for money and i would recommend anyone to give it a go. After the dinner the porter got us a cab to take us out nothing was too much trouble.When we came down to breakfast there was a huge choice. The full english was very nice and there was a huge choice. It was hot and set us up for the day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Well done to all the staff and thank you for a lovely stay and making us feel very welcome..

Reviews.Title: “No frills, free wifi, great location, good for a short term break”
Reviews.Author: pero305
Reviews.Content: The main reason IÂ´ve picked it was its location. It takes you only 15 mins on foot to reach Leicester square. Upon arrival the impressions were not so good; dated rooms and not so large in size. But it all got better as the days were passing by. Surely, IÂ´ve been to better hotels in the same category, but way more expencive. The rooms are clean, carpets recently changed, free wifi (ask fot the password at the reception), a mere 2 min walk to the tube station. If you do not want to be disturbed by housekeeping personnel, they will give you a call around 1 pm to check if you would still need your room to be cleaned. By default, the breakfast is continental, very basic and somewhat dull, but sufficient to start the morning. Best of all - windows can open, which doesnÂ´t seem to be the case with many hotels in London. All in all, if I would find the same price of 80 eur for a double room incl. breakfast, I would pick it up again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great price (Keep in mind it's a budget hotel)”
Reviews.Author: Mike20260
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed in 3 rooms for 4 nights in late March. We are seasoned travelers who enjoy good hotels, but after a week's tour in Ireland we were looking to save money. We were able to check-in upon arrival at 12pm. The rooms were clean and the beds fine. The shower was the strongest I'd ever had! The breakfast buffet was equal to the fine hotels we stayed at in Ireland. Our room had always been cleaned when we returned from breakfast. The staff was very friendly. I imagine it might be hot in summer (no AC), but we were very comfortable. Good value for a great price (Keep in mind it's a budget hotel, not luxury - 3 bath towels per double, soap, no other toiletries).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Hilltowngal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the President for seven nights. It's not a luxury hotel, but it was adequate. The staff was helpful. The room was clean, although it could use some redecorating. We found a great deal through British Air, and continental breakfast was included. For an extra 4.50 pounds each, we could buy the hot English Breakfast. No complaints about either. The location is about a block from the Russell Square tube station. One thing: there were only bath towels provided in the bathroom, and just bars of soap. No facecloths, hand towels, and no shampoos and such. If you like a facecloth, be sure to bring one. We had a room in the front of the hotel, and it was noisy up until about midnight. We were so tired from sightseeing that it didn't matter to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cardyfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, bed and breakfast, hotel rooms are small but really clean, the maid who cleaned our room changed the sheets the whole time we were there. Evening meal was a carvery which was excellent, also the breakfast in the morning was a self service buffet which was great. the hotel is also a street away from the tube, which myself and my husband got on through the stay of our break it only cost 13 pounds for both to ride the tube all day,. Would regommend this hotel to any one on a short break to london really comfy hotel and the staff are really frendly.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel For London Attractions”
Reviews.Author: cassa123
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading some of the negative reviews. I am pleased to say that I was pleasantley suprised. The check in was efficient and friendly and the room was clean with a fairly comfortable bed. Tea and coffee making facilities were also in the room although I would say bring extra tea or coffee as you only get 2 tea bags and 2 coffee sachets. Bathroom not big but clean with shower over the bath, plenty of hot water and 4 bath towels which were changed daily, there is also a hairdryer. The corridors are carpeted which helps keep down any noise when people walk past your room, I am a light sleeper but did not get woken up at all. If you put your do not disturb sign on your door the maid does not wake you up as mentioned in earlier reviews.English Breakfast Buffet if included in the price is okay. We went down at about 8am and it was not very busy at that time. The usual items of sausage, bacon, eggs fried and scrambled, tomatoes, beans, toast and some sort of fish are available. Also cereal and porridge. The location of the hotel is the winner for me just around the corner from Russell Square tube station and not far from Brunswick shopping centre which has a cinema shops and a selection of nice restaurants such as Strada, GBK, Nando's and Carluccio's. I found this hotel to be clean friendly and yes a little old fashioned (I quite like that) but for the price and location it would be hard to beat. I would stay again when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: iwade58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a two night break, and having read some of the reviews, walked in with some trepidation. Yes it needs a lick of paint, and I have thicker hankies than thepillows, but for a great location hotel for the cost it is great!! The staff are very friendly - especially the guy I think is the head porter/security officer, and if you need anything just ask. Breakfast can be a little busy, but come on this is not a small place, the room is always being checked and the tables are clean and tidy. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: FeeFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of a Superbreaks weekend. Rooms great, roomy enough for 3 single bed and room to move. Busy at breakfast time but got a table eventually and food good and plentiful. Near tube station and 10 mins walk to Covent Garden and theatreland. A few good eateries around the square. All staff very friendly. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: beachy1159
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a London break. The decor was dated and the room quality was basic. We did not pay very much for this hotel admittedly but the standard was none the less poor. The room was basic with few amenities, no toiletries apart from soap and an uncomfortable bed. Our breakfast experience on the Sunday was quite something. Never have I seen such a crowded dining room. People were queuing for the second rate cooked breakfast. We were sat near the door with people crowded around us queuing. Not the intimate breakfast experience my husband and I would have appreciated. All in all I would recommend you avoid this hotel. It was dated, not very clean and it seemed very overcrowded, particularly at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location! shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carlos84000
Reviews.Content: me and my fiance stayed here in feb 2011 and had a lovely weekend site seeing and going to shows. the only thing we were disappointed with was the hotel. the location was fantastic with oxford street only a short walk away and the staff (that spoke english) were helpfull but if you value a good nights sleep, a decent breakfast and an acceptable level of cleanliness then avoid this hotel like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “President Hotel - Cheap & Cheerful to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: 498lgm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a long weekend in London. The hotel is a bit dated, but it is clean and comfortable. It was really busy, and all the staff were helpful (apart from the scary head of cleaning who bit my head off when I asked for a hairdryer). The biggest appeal about this hotel is that it is approx 50 yards from Russell Square tube station which is is two stops away from Covent Garden, and four stops away from Piccadilly Circus. In terms of location, it's brilliant if you want to be near all the main sights, and the Russell Square area itself is nice, especially when you're a country bumpkin in the big city. Would consider this hotel again if I was to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm...”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: What can i say about it? I frequently visit London for business purposes and actually stay in this hotel more than once. Well, if you're on budget but on the other hand look for a well located hotel close to underground, i think you've found the place. It certanly needs refurbishment, breakfast is not good, you can use the room key as a sword (if you get attacked by some other swordman:))... My comments are not too good, also the hotel is shabby, but... somehow i am not dissapointed with it. It fits in London, it's a 3* hotel, location is good, and because of it i would give it a pass...

Reviews.Title: “A great 3 Star...Clean, Efficient, Helpful and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: belle_traveller73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and must say that I was a little apprehensive after entering the aged lobby. The room was smaller but very clean and the hotel staff were very helpful when you needed something. The location is fantastic, a quick jaunt to the tube station. The English Breakfast was the same every morning but was freshly available nontheless. If I return to London, I would consider staying here again. Many tours are willing to pick up from this location (i.e. Stonehenge).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great character!”
Reviews.Author: ScoobCW
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It is very close to the tube and is about a 6-10 minute walk from the British Museum. The room was very comfortable, with a double bed, very clean. Bathroom was nice as well, had a full tub which was a surprise. The breakfast was very good. Above standard, it had hot food as well as continental options. Internet was pricey but worked well. Overall great hotel, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no-frills hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: pugsley1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the President for 2 nights on a trip-theatre package, costing Â£250 for 2 of us. The hotel is in a good location a minutes walk from Russell Square tube station and though first impressions seeing the hotel weren't good (it looks like something from the 60's or 70's) we found it adequate enough for our stay. The staff, although generally polite don't say much and our room was small but clean with an old-looking but decent shower, a hairdryer and trouser press in the room free of charge. Our room window overlooked the street at the front of the hotel and though there was a bit of noise at night it wasn't unusual for Central London. The worst bit was probably the bed and lack of pillows. I didn't sleep well first night and my partner didn't sleep well the second night. Breakfast wasn't the best I've ever had either, though there was a good selection on the buffet and plenty of it the food didn't look very appealing, and though it didn't taste bad and my partner enjoyed it, I think somewhere like a Premier Inn does a much better buffet breakfast. Overall we found this hotel perfectly adequate for our needs, the tube station a minute away and unlimited travel around Central London for Â£6.60 per day meant great transport links too, and if you're not expecting luxurious conditions, I'd recommend it to you

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: claridgediane
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find from Russell Square tube station. Quick efficient check in. Room was very clean, bed comfortable and it was surprisingly very quiet despite being on first floor with street view. Bathroom was quite small but adequate and clean. Public areas were well maintained. Breakfast felt a bit like a very busy canteen but food was good and plenty of it. Staff were no over friendly but this didn't bother us. All in all for Â£99 including breakfast we had no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and in very poor repair”
Reviews.Author: nueoff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the President on numerous occasions. The location in Russell Square is excellent: a quiet and safe neighborhood which is very conveniently located within walking distance of most central London attractions. Alas, the President Hotel has deteriorated steadily over the years, and last July we found it has gotten so bad that we vowed we will never stay there again. We were shocked by the condition of our room - absolutely filthy with bad stains on the walls and carpets. The trash was not emptied and the toilet not cleaned after previous guests. Neither the television, toilet, or shower worked properly. Even worse, staff did not respond to our repeated requests to clean the room and repair the broken facilities. You can do a lot better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dina15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights at the end of Sept/beginning of Oct 2010 with my boyfriend and we had a pleasant experience. I got a great deal through a promotion by British Airways. By far the best thing about the hotel is the location. A minute walk to the Russell Square tube stop made it easy to get around and when the weather was nice we were able to walk to anywhere in central London. Also a plus, the tube goes straight from the airport to the Russell Square stop so it saves you a ton of money that you might have spent on a cab. For those looking for a luxury experience this isn't the place for you. The rooms are small but clean and they don't offer a ton of amenities. I read in some reviews that you had to pay for a hair dryer which wasn't the case in our room. Honestly, we didn't spend much time in our room besides watching a little TV to fall asleep at night. Our room faced the front of the hotel and we didn't have any issues with street noise (I live in NYC so I am not as sensitive to street noise as others might be). The free breakfast was so/so: stick with the cold food (cereal, yogurt, fruit) and don't bother spending money on the hot breakfast, it looked bad. Overall, it was an pleasant stay but as I said, I didn't spend much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Alonk
Reviews.Content: First of all, and most important to us (family who wanted to tour London for a week) - Location. The hotel is in a great place, a minute walk from Russel Square tube station, Tesco grocery store Pret A Manger restaurant and the British Museum. The weakest link of this hotel is it's breakfast. The basic deal is a continental breakfast which includes 2 kinds of cereals, preserved fruits, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and toasts with jelly. no cheese or sald at all. If you add a couple of pounds you can also have egg and ham. Our room's window faced the back of an office building and every morning we woke up by a noise of glass bottles and garbage truck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: iluvfrance
Reviews.Content: Pros: -location, location, location. This hotel is one block from the underground, right in the heart of London at Russell Square. Russell Square itself is relatively quiet, so it is nice to return to after a busy day of crowds. -English breakfast included in price of hotel. It is not the best breakfast you will ever have but it is decent and does the job. -lots of elevators, so we never had to wait. -the rooms have free internet access but you need to plug in your computer, there is no wifi. We did have a problem that the internet would disconnect every once in a while and there is a program that restricts which sites you can go to. -room was clean and though small was adequate. -bathroom was a good size with a full size bath. Unlike other reviewers, the water pressure was great and we had all the hot water that was needed. Cons: -the hotel is starting to look dated. The hallways need new carpet and wallpaper, it just looks dirty. -the toilet takes about three minutes to fill up, so you can not flush quickly. -the key is attached to a long steel pole. They want you to turn in the key every time you leave the hotel. This does not take very long but it is a bit of a pain. -there are no in room safes -no bathroom amenities, so make sure you bring your own shampoo Summary: It is not a great hotel and has seen better days but its location is fantastic, the rooms are clean and it has a bit of English charm. If you can get a good price for this hotel than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Door Slamming Noise”
Reviews.Author: PHIL-DES-NOEL-JIM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, but as you gets a lot of groups and parties staying here the background noise a night is very, very poor. The doors are slamming closed all night. The room doors are spring closing and slam very loudly and the adjoining rooms are not sound insulated so you can hear everything. So if you want a good night sleep do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “VERY happy with the decision to stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jame_3355
Reviews.Content: My roomate and I stayed here last April for 4 nights and loved it so much we're going back this May! After having a horrible experience at the hostel across the street we chose the President Hotel simply because it was the first one we saw. Our hopes weren't too high because we had no reservations, and it was almost midnight. We were pleasantly surprised when they told us they had a room for us, AND full breakfast was included! Staff was extremely helpful (with the exception of one girl) gave us tips and remembered us from when we first checked in. Had to give in our key when we left for the day but that seems to be the norm. Yes decor is outdated but how much time do you spend in your room on holidays anyways?! Beds were great, no blowdryer but you can rent one for a deposit of 10Â£ which you get back. Breakfast was superb for being included. Staff were more than happy to set up a cab for us in advance for our early departure to the airport. We had questions about our flight since it was during the time of the volcano, and they even called the airport for us to f Location is AMAZING!! Overall this hotel was fantastic, the fact that it's inexpensive is just a lovely bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed late November - Got out just before the big snow. Room was good 3 star digs. Clean comfortable and warm. Key was on a 2' long bit of thin rod which made it dangerous to sit down at breakfast :), speaking of which, the supplied breakfast was excellent. Location was fine, we had no problems getting around. One night we went to a show in the west end and after the show we started walking back towards Russel Square with the view of getting a bus. After what seemed like about 10 minutes we ended up back at the hotel! Staff were very friendly - especially the lady in charge of breakfast. Lack of internet was the only fault I could find.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but thats it!!”
Reviews.Author: NoDoubtFan82
Reviews.Content: where do I start? okay I'll start with the good: Excellent location a 3 min walk to russell square tube. and walking distance to many resturants. It did offer breakfast which makes it easy to walk down stairs and start your day. Its a pick up hotel for many day tour companys. the bad: Our first night there was a loud whistling coming from the window and we noticed it was out of alignment so cold air was coming in. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. They did have it fixed the next day, which was excellent. the shower head sucked! it dripped water out, i had to get a cup and fill the cup to wash the shampoo out of my hair.
