After 2 nights of this horrible shower head we called and asked if we could change rooms or get a new shower head. they said it would be fixed the next day. they did fix it but it only lasted a day, went back to sucking. the noise was awful, you could hear everything! doors slamming, people talking, tvs, drunk people from the pub. our first night the neighbors had people over and they were loud, the second night they had more people over and i felt we were in the party too. this went well into the night. couldnt sleep until they left before slamming the door a dozen times. the people that worked her were very rude, everyone hated their life. though they did offer breakfast, it never changed the week we were there. it got old real fast. i know locations are hard to come by but i think next time we'll spend a little more for a better quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deborah4967
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 1/2 block from Russell Square tube station and block from Brunswick Mall shops, restaurants and supermarket , Lambs Conduit and Southampton Row restaurants. Helpful, friendly staff, clean crisp linens changed daily (put out Do Not Disturb card or they will wake you at 8:00am to service the room!). BUT, no toiletries, no facial tissue, no hair dryer, thin rough towels, no clock/radio (request wake-up call), no mini-fridge, no pad and pen. If your room includes Continental Breakfast, forget it and buy good, cheap full English breakfast in the neighborhood; if your room includes the Full English Breakfast, tolerate it and spend more on lunch. Fifteen minute walk to Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square and TKTS booth for half-price theater tickets. Two blocks from British Museum and Dickens House. Piccadilly tube line goes all the way to Heathrow in an hour, or the hotel will book a shuttle for you. We stayed here 12 nights. Next trip we will look for a hotel in the theater district where we went every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lousy staff”
Reviews.Author: ecaarch
Reviews.Content: While not the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, this was far from the best. Staff seemed focused on THEIR convenience, not the guests. For example, housekeeper was banging on my door at 8:00am to clean my room even though I was not due to checkout until the next day. Housekeeper returned at 8:15am and again at 8:30am. When I went to breakfast at 10:30am, I put the card on my door requesting my room be cleaned, but I had evidently missed my single opportunity for service. My room was never cleaned. Staff at breakfast was intent on clearing the dining room promptly at 11:00am, snatching salt & pepper, sugar, etc. from tables while guests were still eating. Vacuuming the dining room while guests are still eating is just not right. Staff made it abundantly clear that breakfast was over and guests were to leave. While the hotel provides wired internet service in the rooms, MANY websites are blocked. This can be very annoying if trying to check e-mail or confirm travel plans. All in all, a great location but would def skip this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “comfy,good situation,london hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy19_10
Reviews.Content: stayed a few times, rooms comfy and clean, breakfast fine, great position for sight seeing

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location !”
Reviews.Author: damjanh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just arround the corner of Russell Square metro station, from where you have all London on your hand. Hotel is overall in a good shape. Rooms are medium sizes, bathrooms are maybe a little tiny, beds are comfortable, the staff is helpfull...I realy dont have any complains. Its not a luxury hotel and its not a dump. Something in between. Its worth of its price, definetly.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm... im not quite sure what to say”
Reviews.Author: girly_gadget
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and is very reasonably priced for staying in central london although i do think i have been spoiled very recently by staying in really good 4 / 5 * for my main holidays and stayin in the new modern holiday inn expresses. So i felt the President was very old fashioned in need of a makeover but i think this was more because of the hotels I usually stay in and was probably more because of this and there wasnt actually anything wrong with it. I didnt feel that the rooms were the cleanest that they could be but again this could just because the hotel is older. In the reception of the hotel there is a horrible smell of what i thought smelled of ham. Staff all seemed pleasant enough. Breakfast in the morning was the usual full english as well as various cereals. But the cooked breakfast was only lukewarm. I am probably giving hotel more of bad write up than it deserves. If your wanting a basic hotel in a excellant location at a good price then this would be fine for you. I suppose the question would be would i stay again ...... well probably not i would pay the extra for the park inn or the hotel russell which i love. please feel free to contact me if you havew any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in superb location.”
Reviews.Author: tofty75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner on the 16th November 2010 for 1 night as a surprise trip for my birthday. I don't know what all the negative comments are about. The hotel was very clean and the room was more than adequate in size with a comfortable double bed and large bay window. the bathroom was also spacious and very clean with a decent shower. the corridors to the hotel smelt very fresh which straight away gave the impression of cleanliness. Im very fussy about hotels and this one was absolutely fine. The corridors were slightly dated but who cares about a corridor. The following morning we went down for breakfast. It was about 0915 and it was fairly busy. The wait for a table was only about 5 minutes which gave us enough time to come round after a night out in London! My partner just had toast and juice. I had a full english breakfast which was lovely. It couldnt be faulted. The breakfast was in the style of a help yourself buffet and included bacon, sausage, fried eggs, scrambled eggs, tomatoes, beans and toast. It was tasty and the food was hot. I could not complain and it set me up for the day. The coffee was also good. We heard a couple behind us complaining that they had to serve themselves.....would you do that if you went to America where everything is in the style of a buffett! Overall i was impressed with the stay at the President and would definately book again. The location is superb, only a 1 minute walk to Russel Square tube station but if you didnt fancy the tube it was only about 20 minutes walk to the centre towards Leicester square and other central locations. Euston station is only a 5 - 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with the President Hotel - good location and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Lindilou11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the President from 9th to 12th November. It's in a great location and very close to Russell Square tube station. The room was good with an excellent shower and bath. Clean sheets etc every day. The mattress was a bit on the hard side but ok. We had the English breakfast every morning and it was adequate for a 3* hotel. It was good value for money and gave us a pleasnt base for our stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “clean,comfy and convienient”
Reviews.Author: SATISFIEDCUSTOMER89
Reviews.Content: this hotel offered good food,clean rooms,and was very convienient for the theartes with only a ten minute walk from euston station.also fifteen minute walk to most theartes.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, good location, very poor breakfast. staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: moranashtamker
Reviews.Content: we stayed in president hotel from the 19th to 23th of october, the first day we got very small rooms in the 6th floor, which should not be a problem because there is an elevator, but the actual rooms were in the 6 and a half floor which had a few steps to it and a really small hallway, it was really hard to get all 9 bags and 4 elderly people throuth to the rooms. the next day we asked to get bigger rooms that has an elevator all the way to the rooms and got it. we had 3 rooms and we wanted a freege. the rude receptionist said that they dont give that to anyone but just to people with medicine. that was after we were promised a freege. finally after a few arguments we got one freege in one of the rooms. THE BREAKFAST: very very poor, you have coffee tea and milk, 4 kinds of cereal. toast, jam and some fruits. NO EGGES (they were extra charge) NO BACON (for my unjewish review readers, i personnaly dont eat that) the rooms were very clean, the sheets were changed every day. you can get an adaptor for 2 pounds deposit. the location is GREAT: you have the russel squere tube around the corner and it is one of the picadilly line (blue line) which goes all the way to the airport with no changing lines. all together the most important thing is that we had fun. came back home a little hungry :) YOU HAVE TO INSIST TO GET WHAT YOU PAID FOR SO DONT BE SHAY.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: ktheidon
Reviews.Content: While the location is convenient, the hotel itself is akin to a youth hostel. 2 of the 5 elevators were out of service; the television did not function; the smell of mold (on the 7th floor) prompted me and two other colleagues to request a room change; the promised internet did not work on the 7th floor but improved on the 6th; messages left for us were not delivered; and the breakfast is a riot scene. In sum, a good location but there are much better values to be found in the vicinity. This hotel needs to clean up, touch up and remember that customer service does matter.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Treat”
Reviews.Author: baby92scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The President Hotel for the weekend travelling down from Scotland. It was an 18th Birthday treat for my daughter. My husband, daughter, her boyfriend and myself. The hotel is centrally located for Oxford Street, Covent Garden and most London attractions being a taxi or tube ride away. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful, the beds clean and comfy. Overall the hotel was ideal for a cheap and cheerful weekend away. We are now planning our next trip down to London and we will be staying The President Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussieagent1
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent it was important to give feedback on this hotel. I would reccomend to people who are on a budget who want a clean and comfortable room. It is not luxurious but not priced that way either. Rooms were small but thats London. Price was good for London and the location was great. 100m from the Russel square tube station with many restaurant options easy walk. Also walked to the theatre in covent garden area approx 15mins. Convenience store round the corner, free wifi in lounge off main foyer had poor reception on iphone but others seem to have no problem on laptops. Breakfast room was very busy but quick flow of people meant litterally no waiting to get table. Overall, perfect location, comfortable bed, cheap as for London, we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel - ideal for overnight or few days stay”
Reviews.Author: vcampbell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for evening and one night on 07 October 2010 and was pleasantly surprised - OK rooms are basic and paint on outside window frames peeling a bit , furniture a bit dark but room very clean. Check in was very quick - I also went to the bar in the sister hotel next door, the Imperial and had a meal which was good. I had a sound night's sleep and although paid for a single room was given a double. Breakfast next morning very good, crowded, and I had to share a table but that didn't worry me. I would certainly recommend this hotel, staff very pleasant, check-out very quick, in a very central location - but as a previous traveller commented - watch out for the room keys, they have a foot-long rod on them!

Reviews.Title: “If you want 5 *****, Go to the Savoy.......”
Reviews.Author: wabssnr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the 8th and 9th October, for a theatre break. And were pleasantly surprised. Hotel was just round the corner from the tube station(Russel Square). Room was good size, bathroom was clean and the shower was great. Breakfast was self service with a good range, didnt have to wait long for a table. For a 3 star we had nothing to complain about. You get what you pay for and we were very happy. Like the title say's "if you WANT 5*****, Go to the SAVOY......

Reviews.Title: “Great location ideal for sightseeing break”
Reviews.Author: arightman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the president hotel for 3 nights at the end of september.It is an ideal central location and is only one stop from London Kings Cross and is very easy to find. The hotel if adequate for a citybreak and staff are all friendly and will help you out with any problems.The rooms are okay a little bit dated but lets be honest we dont go to london to spend our time in a hotel room.The room has basic facilities ie tv kettle and your own bathroom but is no worse than any other hotels I have stayed in London.A word of advice take your own towel with you.The ones provided are useless and its like drying your self with sandpaper. We were staying on the fourth floor and were facing the street overlooking the main entrance to the hotel but could hardly here street noise through the night although from about 6 in the morning you can smell the breakfast. Breakfast time is very hectic and you may need to que unless you want to sit beside someone else.It is a buffet full english breakfast which is okay there is plenty to choose from so there is definately stuff to eat for all tastes.Drinking in the sportsbar at night is reasonably priced. It is roughly 15 mins to tottenham court road and oxford street and walking is easier than changing tubes at holburn.All in all enjoyed stay at president and dont listen to the negative reviews.will be going back to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: meryltime
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at his hotel end had a very nice time.the room was cleanand comfortablean the continental breakfasts were adequate for us.staff friendly .helpful and polite.Plenty of hot water .only complmentry soaps in bathrooms .but knowing it to be a three star hotel did not expect anything else.for the price we paid it worth it .dont understand those who book three star hotels and expect five star accomadation.would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sonia1012
Reviews.Content: Location was good, the room was very small, no hairdryer had to pay 10 pounds (20 AUD) as a deposit !!! 5 pounds (10 AUD) for a jug of tap iced tap water to be brought to the room. Tea and coffee facilities terrible kettle was disgusting. The shower was like a tap and then flooded the bathroom, we reported this and were told housekeeping would fix it but of course they didnt !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a dreadful night”
Reviews.Author: iloveweekends
Reviews.Content: Rooms on the front are ok but highly sought after. This is because the rest of the rooms are overlooking the service yards and kitchens and are very noisy and really smelly! My first room had noisy pipes which sounded like a fire alarm, so I was moved into a room which stank of stale shepherds pie. I was told this was because it was only on the third floor! My third and final room was on the 5th floor and less smelly. I was woken throughout the night by lorries, clanking, trolleys etc and finally at 6am by the laundry delivery truck. Sleep was impossible. In the morning I asked to speak to the manager and was told to fill out a form and that someone would contact me. Needless to say, they haven't. Stay in a Premier Inn or a Travelodge - or anywhere really.....

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget London stay, especially good for Museum”
Reviews.Author: Magic_Bryan
Reviews.Content: One of my little ventures without the missus, where I tend to go for basic clean accommodation. The place is smack on Russell square, round the corner from the Tube Station and the Tesco express. Hint number one - do not take the stairs at Russell Square tube station unless you're very fit, many gasping travellers make that mistake. If you're planning to hit the British Museum, you're golden, and it's not exactly far from Oxford Road/Theatreland, but the nearby tube means you're fine for getting around anywhere. The President is part of a small chain round Bloomsbury and seems to be the sweet spot for value versus facilities. I spent most of my time on this trip at an event at the nearby Royal National (as an aside, some friends were staying here and it was plagued by kids rampaging round the corridors and seemed nowhere near as nice - do yourself a favour and spend the extra couple of quid at the President.) Reception was well run and staff were very friendly and helpful (especially so by London standards) no worries checking in, also smooth leaving luggage on the day I was checking out. Word of caution - if you resent leaving your room key at reception, you've got a shock coming - instead of the usual oversize fobs, the keys are on long rods which you'll only put in your pocket if you want to risk an alarming injury. The rods cleverly slot into holes on the key rack to make it easy for the staff to grab them. I didn't eat evening meal in the restaurant, but breakfast was fine. Not amazing, but plenty of it and reasonable variety for the money. Once again in my reviews, I recommend if you're going to eat breakfast in the hotel, buy it as part of your package, as it will save you a ton of cash. Believe you can have continental or FEB, my package included FEB. Similarly didn't use the bar, as I know a couple of pubs nearby that are pretty decent. For most people in London, you're going to be doing stuff away from the hotel most of the time and will be kipping there and grabbing a shower and that's about it. My room was clean, pretty well equipped for London money and very pleasant. Good window insulation, a big factor in London, as it's too easy to be hassled by street noise in older cheaper hotels, no worries here though. Trouser press, telly, kettle etc, shower , bath and loo en suite. No mini bar or safe, but safes at reception and limited number of fridges available, with preference given to people needing them for meds. baby milk etc. Bed was a decent size and comfy. Room was well cleaned and all the staff were great. No compy toileteries other than soap, but you can ask for shower gel etc at reception - not a worry as I take my own normally anyway. Overall, the staff are great, location is very good, and for the money, it's very hard to beat in London. When I go to London doing the usual touristy stuff with the missus, we ususally go to the Thistle Trafalgar, which is a smashing place, but the difference in price could amount to a couple of shows or decent restaurant meals. Very good compromise between economy and cleanliness - basic and clean in a good way. Final note as a general thing - get hold of an Oyster card for an easy way to get round London - we live in South Yorkhire, but both have Oyster cards for occasional forays to the smoke (and/or out company offices there!) and if you do try the President (which I can recommend with no qualms) try the nearby Thai Dream restaurant, or if you want an eaterie nearer theatreland, Arbutus gives you Michelin star food on the cheap, pre theatre menu is a bargain - can't remember the last time I spent time in London and didn't eat there at least once. As ever with my reviews, feel free to drop me a message if you want more info. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Great Base. Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sunshinekeighley
Reviews.Content: Could not really have a better base for all major attractions. We walked because the weather was nice but close to tube if required. We travelled with Superbreak and ok the hotel is not The Ritz but was clean and comfortable. Great choice at breakfast and yes we did have to share our table with another couple but no problem, they were very nice and friendly. Didn't need to eat again until evening. Staff very polite. All in all super value and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elliepAbingdonVa
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful location, marvelous breakfast, ! Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Donnamay55
Reviews.Content: This is an older Hotel, but well maintained. It is located very close to the Russell Square tube station (less than 2 blocks) - an easy walk for even older travelers. The staff is helpful and accomodating. The room was much roomier than we expected, and the "English" breakfast, while not all the items were good, had enough choices to fit any diet. At night the restuarant became a "carvery" and the roast beef was excellent, and the vegetables fresh and well cooked. Free wi fi was offered in the spacious and comfortable atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for museums and Euston Station”
Reviews.Author: kendoon
Reviews.Content: Hotel spotlessly clean and with excellent breakfast. One night I had a double room as single and another night I had a dedicated single room. But the price was the same!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: andymac67
Reviews.Content: I booked my wife into this hotel for 7 nights as i was having Neuro surgery in a nearby Hospital.On the Sat morning she went for Breakfast where it is supposed to be residents only and got her Handbag stolen by 2 guys who came in of the street from her table when she went to get her Breakfast,She lost alot of personal stuff and alot of Money and not one member of management confronted her about it or asked her if she was ok.It was the porters who helped her and looked after her. I was disgusted by what has happened and i will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location compensates for typical London overpriced shabbiness”
Reviews.Author: Rybas
Reviews.Content: I almost forgive this hotel for being what most hotels are in London: overpriced in any price range. Despite the general shabbiness, it was a great place for visiting London. Avoid the free dinner at the hotel's Saracen Restaurant they offer in their Internet deal; better spend the voucher in any other nearby place of the chain. Good English breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssheaff
Reviews.Content: the hotel represents great value for money, rooms were clean and tidy. Very good breakfast and pleasant friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: catherine_roberts64
Reviews.Content: booked a two night stay at the president through superbreaks , the hotel is very dated and needs an overhaul. our room had scuff marks along the wall where people had dragged their suitcases through the door , dont expect nice fluffy towels they are awful small and smelly not to mention dirty . only soap in the bathroom and the cleaners try to clean your room from 8am. as for breakfast its a disgrace , lukewarm and lack of choice not much good if you are a vegetarian or like me a vegan even though i was told we would be catered for . you have to share your table at breakfast unless you get down early ie. 7am.the sleep quality is not good we even heard the people next door unzip their sitcases the walls are that thin .there is doors slamming constantly and people talking in the corridor . we would stay somewhere more central next time as its too far too walk to anywhere decent , i wouldent stay here anyway as im sure you could find a lot better else where

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable and no nonsense accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Ticketybo0
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Superbreak deal at the President hotel. Having read the reviews that preceded my stay I have to say I was dreading what was to come. As my husband had booked the weekend for our anniversary I was worried in case it all went pear-shaped. i emailed the hotel directly with some of my (minor) concerns. Replies were almost instantaneous, polite and courteous and served to put my mind at rest. Upon arrival to the hotel, check in was quick and efficient. Rooms were clean, perhaps a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate. Pillows were plentiful, as were towels and a fridge was already installed for my medical needs. Breakfast was a very busy affair, although not unpleasant. The lady serving as Maitre D' was very efficient and a real pro at keeping what was a hectic time to a calm, businesslike process. The food itself was fine, I would go as far as to say that it was the best buffet hot breakfast I have had, coffee was good and yes, we were offered seats sharing with others at tables, but we were prepared to wait for a table on our own and it wasn't long before we were sat at our table. The hotel decoration etc was admittedly a bit of a 70's throwback, but wasn't tatty. All in all a good experience, good location and would definitely return when visiting London again. The President offered good value for money - you want more than this, go for a higher star rating, this was perfectly acceptable three star accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Better off elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: reisert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President twice in August 2010 and was not very pleased. The staff started off the bat with giving me grief about that the booking agency had not sent one particular page that the hotel said they needed. They then proceeded to give me the incorrect category of breakfast--they had English vs. Continental and then the staff charged me extra because of the error. The hotel also did not have wifi and you had to give a 5 pound deposit for them to give you an ethernet cable the first time and it looked like that was not even available during my second stay. To boot, the beds listed during both stays. If you plan to stay there, it may be a good idea to get mobile broadband from a UK mobile company as it would be almost as cheap.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hecticmum03
Reviews.Content: room we stayed in on the 5 th floor was very spacious for a double fitted cot and pushchair in staff friendly and helpful break fast was ok not fantastic on the 1st night but was better the next night no toiletries says everyone else so what i woulldnt use it anyway like my own brand of shampoo thankyou we have to close window at night for baby but room was slightly to warm what do u expect in summer would defineltly book again the reviews are based on each room so its hard to rate the hotel itself

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: katwot
Reviews.Content: the only good thing about this hotel is the location.The first room i checked into have a large wet patch on the bed and was soaked all the way through and when i went to reception to complain they sent a porter up who accused me of spilling something myself! Breakfast was very poor. the cooked part was luke warm and inedible and the only other option was stale bread rolls or tasteless cereal. The pillows in the room were unbelievably thin and i asked three different members of staff for more pillows and did not get any. i really recommend anyone else to stay anywhere but here and i shall not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend staying here while visiting london.”
Reviews.Author: scottishmotherof3
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed in london for 4 nights and travelling with 3 kids found it difficult finding a hotel to accommodate 5 at a reasonable rate. The president rented us 2 rooms that joined in the middle, one a double the other a twin with extra bed put in. The rooms were clean, both with showers and toilet facilities, hair dryer, kettle and tv. beds were very comfortable. road noise was quite loud but totally expected being right on russell square. Breakfast was a good selection, good service. I dont have anything negative to say about the hotel. The location was great, 2 mins walk to the underground station that will take you anywhere you need to go in london. Tesco express directly across from the underground. shops and eating places on the same street and cabs everywhere. would definatly go back there as its a great base for good clean standard and value for money. hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Basic amenities - reduce expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Igboreviewer
Reviews.Content: The President hotel offers a great price for the location. On the positive side, it is minutes away from the Russel Square tube station and close to many popular attractions within central London. We stayed in a room on the 5th floor overlooking the atrium - not too noisy. You can purchase theatre tickets from the front desk as well as arrange for tours.There is a restaurant that is open for buffet breakfast and a sit-down dinner. On the downside, if you are used to staying at a typical Norh American hotel you will need to reduce your expectations. Upon check-in, staff offered minimal information about hotel services. Our room offered only basic amenities - double bed, tv with remote, 2 bath towels, toilet paper, small bar soaps, tea and coffee. Do not expect to see the following items in your room: air conditioning or fan, mini fridge, tissue box, clock radio, face cloths, hair dryer, ice box or an iron. July 2010 was particularly hot in London with 30C temperatures and it did occassionally become unbearably hot in the room with no fan or A/C (or ice). For ironing, one could go down to the 2nd floor ironing room where a single iron on a timer is available. For internet access, one could pay to have access to an antiquated machine in the foyer with a rolling ball instead of a mouse (1 pound for 15 minutes access). The bathroom sinks have a separate faucet for hot and cold water which could be a bit tricky if your are travelling with a young child. The full breakfast buffet was quite nice but it consisted of the same items everyday. No pancakes or waffles for young kids. Overall, our stay at the hotel was adequate however I will more than likely try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “old school but adequate”
Reviews.Author: ninkyDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed here as a base for British Library and University College London - excellent location and right beside tube stop. Seemed to be lots of German tour groups staying here too. It was old school - reminded me of a bigger version of Fawlty Towers (tho the service was better!). There was an actual key for the room - haven't seen that for years! Despite the smell of carvery permeating the lobby - and most of the building in fact - this was a good budget option. Single room was suprisingly spacious, and spotless. There was a bit of a desk and chair for getting work done, and while there is no wifi, there seemed to be a socket for internet cables. One bad thing in summer was that there is no Air Conditioning - when I opened my window, all these big extractor fans from the kitchens were blowing a carvery/fried food smell into my room. Nice. Bathroom was good - though no shampoos etc, just soap. no hairdryer, but one was available from Housekeeping on paymentof a Â£10 deposit. Hearty breakfast - again the fried food smell was a bit extreme, and stuck to my clothes for the day. If you want a full English, it was pretty good, but the selection of cereals, breads and fruits was ABYSMAL [tinned orange and grapefruit segments, white sliced pan that is toasted on one side only...] The staff seemed very helpful - the porters desk will book tours, shows and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay. Only good...”
Reviews.Author: bisonbison
Reviews.Content: Not the best place to stay. Only good thing was really that it was a place to rest at night and keep our bags. For what we paid, it was ver dated. Probably the WORST continental breakfast I have ever had (toast sitting under a heat lamp got me the most). The concierge (sp?) service was actually very helpful around 11:00 pm when we wanted to book a couple tours. That, and that alone was the best part. The dial up speed wifi in the 'atrium' was also less than impressive. Overall, very overpriced and wickedly awful food!!

Reviews.Title: “It is ok but the Imperial one is better and only Â£7 more expensive”
Reviews.Author: momiji-momiji
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the President hotel for two nights. It was clean and kind of ok. Single rooms are facing the inner yard, so there is no street noise, however there is a constant and very disturbing noise from something, which looks like generators or is just the air conditioning system. My room was on the second floor right above these generators and it was impossible to sleep even with ear plugs. Breakfast is the same as in the Imperial hotel, low quality food English breakfast, even the fruits (oranges and grapefruits) are soaked in some unidentified sauce and taste strange. But there was one kind of cereals which was ok. Room could not be locked from inside and generally did not feel very safe. Just right after I got in the room for the first time and was in the bathroom, someone opened the door, did not get in as I creamed but left quickly without any apology. When I went downstairs and I asked the key section guy if all the room keys are the same and told him what happened, he assured me that probably it was someone from the housekeeping staff. Room was a good size for a single room. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: JulieGYeovil
Reviews.Content: Difficult one to review really. A hotel that clearly strives to be satisfactory (although no more). Room reasonably clean, basic supplies in bathroom (no shampoo). No hairdryer, but you can have one for a Â£10 deposit. Breakfast is definitely an experience - apparantly it is busy because it is breakfast time. Expect to be sat with others on the same table - unless you are very very assertive. The staff in Saracen are very very busy and preoccupied and service is not high on their list of priorities. Although not out and out rude though. You would be just as well to book into one of the more famous budget brands.

Reviews.Title: “basic but value for money”
Reviews.Author: wharriers
Reviews.Content: just returned from a two night stay at the President hotel - we booked with superbreaks and the weekend was excellent value for money. However, we 'upgraded' from the set hotel which was the Imperial which turned out to be the hotel next door. Not sure why the President was classed as an 'upgrade' as the imperial appeared to be newer and had a much better restaurant! Despite this the rooms were clean and the breakfast was good. Down side - no toiletries - no hairdrier - no fridge and no safe. It was a bit far out from central London for walking (possible but a bit of a trek) Nevertheless it was close to the underground and the buses were plentiful and regular. We had a room at the front of the hotel overlooking Russel square and whilst it was a fairly nice view it was VERY noisy and very hot. - no air conditioning. I would probably recommend it in terms of value but for us (over sixties) it was a bit too far out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: noamat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located, staff is helpful. Rooms are quiet. Not very fancy but for London it's great value for the money. This was our third stay here and we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “bit rough!”
Reviews.Author: jamburger
Reviews.Content: we had a bed on wheels! grea location, staff are nice, room bit shabby! would use again as the location suits well, but it need a slap!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are fine, food not so great. Wizard keys.”
Reviews.Author: fancyrats
Reviews.Content: My room appeared clean, was a reasonable size and everything worked. One of those hotels where everything is subtly shrunk to make the rooms smaller - my bed looked like a double but I think most couples would find it rather crowded - it looked just a little shorter and narrower than normal. No shower gel / shampoo but 4 bars of soap in a single room - not sure what that says! Window was open when I arrived, and I left it open - room nice and fresh and cool, but some street noise. Didn't disturb me on the first night but was woken up by a gang of drunk lads threatening to 'take you down' at 2am on the second. Not quite sure why the room key has to be on a 12in long steel wand, but makes opening the door with a load of luggage challenging. Breakfast wasn't great - scrambled egg was particularly flavourless, and toast soggy. Coffee surprisingly drinkable. As I stayed 2 nights, I was offered a free evening meal and chose to eat at the Royal National's buffet restaurant. The quality of the food in a restaurant that appeared to cater almost exclusively for large groups of foreign schoolchildren was bad enough to make me resent eating it, even though I hadn't paid for it! No wonder English food has a bad international reputation. Limp salad, chicken in wine sauce that was so flavourless you not only couldn't taste the wine in the sauce but you'd have been hard-pushed to identify the chicken from taste alone. Stay at the hotel but be cautious of the food!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - enjoyed evening meal, good food, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: goldengirlDorset
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed one night. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower was a good size and the view from the window very pleasant. It is on a busy road in central London so there was traffic noise despite the secondary double glazing. We had a very enjoyable evening meal with good food and helpful staff. The price was very reasonable. We had a salad buffet with lots of choice and as much as you wanted. We had a bottle of sparking wine, enormous sized sweets and some coffee all for Â£60 (for four). Having read some of the reviews, our expectations were not high but we were delighted with everything about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 1 night to be as central as...”
Reviews.Author: dre4m-on
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night to be as central as possible in London. It is in a perfect location in Russell Square to get to everywhere; walking distance from Kings Cross/St Pancras, Oxford Street, Picadilly Circus, Covent Garden, Theatreland/Shaftsbury Avenue and more. The rooms are basic but adequate, clean with comfortable beds and plenty of space. The english breakfast included in our room rate was well worth going for - lots of hot and cold food all buffet style and you could go back for seconds if you so wished (we didn't indulge but we saw a few who did!). Concierge, porters and reception staff were all helpful and seemed pleased to see you (a rarity in the capital) and there are plenty of lifts to get you to the higher floors, we never had to wait long for one. I recommend the Night and Day pub attached to the hotel for a cold drink after a hard day's shopping or sightseeing, sit outside and watch the world go by. All in all a good stay, no complaints and I would stay again for value for money and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel forgot the little things that stop's it from being a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: seasideannie
Reviews.Content: Take your own shampoo and shower gels. Tea and coffee facility - 'mean' to say the least. If you like nice fluffy towels - take your own. If you ring down, housekeeping do bring the little extras, that is not what one wants to do after a long journey and a busy schedule. A very busy hotel and multi national. I do not like to think of visitors to this county going away with the impression that they are being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: toucans38
Reviews.Content: We were nervous about booking this hotel as we had read some bad reviews, but the location was perfect. The room and bathroom seemed to have been recently redone. Things matched, were not shabby. Service was extremely prompt and courteous. The included continental breakfast was mediocre but certainly adequate. For an old, moderately priced hotel, it more than met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: uniqueHexham
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel , staff very helpfull and friendly, food excellent i couldnt fault it in any way

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: sarahpiglet2002
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I arrived, seeing a sign by the lift stating "IF WINDY PLEASE CLOSE WINDOWS"....... Checking into the hotel was quick - reception could def do with a make over. I was given my room key which had the biggest keyring ever on it so you had to hand it back into reception when you leave the hotel. The room was clean and served our purpose - a place to crash and get ready in the morning. We wasn't going to be spending much time in there so it didn't really matter what the hotel was like. I am not sure that I would go back again in a hurry but served its purpose. It was rather noisy in the morning with the traffic outside but not unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: RachelNorthEast22
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but what else do you expect staying in london? Small but clean with all the basics - tv and towels. 20 second walk to nearest tube - very convenient! Breakfast was a bit manic but all part of the fun, you never no who your going to end up sitting with! Cooked breakfast well worth investing in great start to the day, we were there prompt at 8 every morning and it was already busy so get there sharp. Lovely to see old fashioned porter desk who would do anything from give tourist advice to flag down a taxi (embarrassed to say we didnt even tip them to do this) and small charge to keep our bags locked away on check out day (our train wasnt til 7) Only fault was the restaurant - basically a bar attached to the hotel that does fast food, nothing special! But Russel Square is full of restaurants you don't go far before finding something you fancy

Reviews.Title: “Really good budget central hotel”
Reviews.Author: grannytofive
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 4th - 7th June travelling by train from Aberdeen with my daughter in law as a treat for her, the hotel is extremely well situated just round the corner from the tube station, we were in Room 673 which was a twin bedded room but was certainly on the small side it also overlooked the back of the hotel probably would like another room if we stay again. That said everything else was fine, clean sheets and towels every day , we found the staff cheerful and helpful the breakfast in the morning was absolutely fine, something for everyone - will return to London with my husband in October, would definitely stay here again, we also discovered the tube comes straight into Russell Square from Heathrow which is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “solid 3, clean, friendly, miss breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PastTimesWriter
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: in Bloomsbury off Russell Square, one block from tube station, two blocks from supermarket, many restaurants located very close. Couple of blocks from British Museum and Oxford Street. Rooms: clean, bedding/towels changed daily and no grungy spots in the bathroom. Please note there are no toiletries, just hand soap. No Air conditioning. Breakfast: food adequate but too busy so tables were filthy, not set, had to wait for cutlery/cups/plates at the buffet. Better off going to one of the small restaurants for cheap, clean, good breakfast. Internet access: in room is UK telephone (not Ethernet) and wi-fi is available in the Atrium Lounge but do not attempt between 8:45am-5:15pm as it becomes so slow you cannot access email. Staff: friendly and helpful. Laundry: it is a service 15 pounds for 5kg bag. Please note: This is a very busy hotel with many tour packages going through. It is located in a busy area so there is road noise. For the location and cleanliness I will book here again but will not eat at the hotel again so be warned with that one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, and perfect for my needs!”
Reviews.Author: travelfunLondon
Reviews.Content: Staying at the President hotel was ideal for me as I was studying to a deadline at the uni all weekend and wanted somewhere close, clean and basic. I stayed in a single room and to my surprise it was really clean, some 3 star hotels are often quite grimy and you feel like wearing your flip flops just to have a shower..this hotel room was not like that!! Service was great. When I finally lay down to sleep and found the bed springs to be a little worse for wear, so much so I couldn't sleep, when I called reception at 1am they found me another room straightaway and I tottled off with the porter and found an equally clean room with slightly better springs! I will stay again. Oh and room service breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MarieTRuncorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the President for the 3rd time over the Bank Holiday, we like it for it's locality, the cleasnliness of the rooms, nice hot showers, good bars and restaurant, very friendly staff and the value for money. We booked it through Superbreaks, and we're going again at the end of this month. We have stayed in various hotels in London over the years and this is my favourite,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryGrace2
Reviews.Content: We found the President Hotel to be a welcoming, comfortable and friendly place to stay in busy London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ipsoss66
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend stay in London at the President, we went on a superbreaks rail break and I can recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is superb, very close to tube and buses, and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, with a nice little pub in the opposite lane. Staff were friendly and attentive, check in was a breeze. Rooms are clean and tidy, a little dated it has to be said, but comfy and perfectly fine for the money we paid. Breakfast was tasty, with plenty on offer, but it does get very busy so I would recommend getting down early if you can. 50p charge per bag to hold your luggage on check out is a bargain too, saves on left luggage at the railway station!!. Only a 10 minute stroll to Kings Cross Rail station too. We would definetely stay here again, in fact, we intend to...................... highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: 1965jc
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with my husband. The hotel location is ideal as it is less than a five minute walk from Russel Square tube station and despite being so close, you still get a good night sleep. The hotel reception is welcoming and the staff very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, with tea and coffee making facilites and also a trouser press. The dining room is very pleasant and the staff again are very helpful and friendly. The food served caters from everyone. Check out is at 11am, but there is a room available to store your luggage, if you aren't traveling until later in the day. This costs 50p. We will definitely being staying here again and would happily recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Cork_IrelandIrish
Reviews.Content: My wife Jacinta and I stayed for five (5) nights the hotel was very good. The staff very very polite and helpful. The rooms were small but ok for the price, the bed was changed and made up fresh every morning as were the in-suite towels. Tea and coffee was available in the room as was a trouser press. Hair dryer was not but could be hired at the desk as could a mobile phone charger and internet facility was also available. Wi-Fi was also available in the lounge. The breakfast was ok and an evening meal was available at a modest cost (cheaper than outside). The hotel located off Russell Square was only a fifteen (15) minute walk from the Thames river (Victoria enbankment).

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: anonymous-visitor
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best option in London in terms of value and location. While having been disappointed with so many hotels and B&Bs in London, I have found this hotel extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “It is very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: CristianeH
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the President for 6 nights and were very pleased: good sized clean room and bathroom, great shower, hot water, heating, mattress and blankets. Bathroom was spotless, and towels were good too! ItÂ´s very nice to have a tea/coffee making facility, but then all hotels i've stayed in London have. Creamer and sugar were also provided. English breakfast was just the way i like it: Bacon, eggs (scrambled, boiled or fried!) sausages, toasts, etc. Location is excellent, with bus n. 7 and Russell Square tube just around the corner. Reception staff friendly and the lady responsible for the breakfast was very nice!! Just adorable! The President hotel was like home. I am very satisfied for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located & Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: lovelye
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located around the corner from Russel Sq tube station (line that goes direct to Heathrow Airport) with a pub, market & cafe just steps away. Room was clean & spacious, as I booked a double for same price other hotels were offering for single/twin room. No wifi in the rooms, (if you happen to have an ethernet cable handy, its possible to connect in your room) but they do offer FREE wifi in the lounge. Continental breakfast was included but for 4Â£ more I'd say splurge for the full English Breakfast. The staff was very pleasant. Only negatives, the hotel did feel a bit dated & the walls fairly thin, but not loud enough to keep me up at night. Either way it was a great deal, in an amazingly central location and had everything I needed for my short stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: DebsDundee
Reviews.Content: Just back from president hotel in london and thougth it was ok. Hotel looks very dated from outside but inside main foyer was really nice. Beds had a hard mattress which wasnt very comfortable. Room was very dated though but we were not in the room much. Staff on reception friendly and pointed us in right direction for buses etc. Breakfast in the morning was hectic although the 2 days we were there we got seated right away. Limited selection of cereals on offer and a cooked breakfast although this was cold and that was us down for breakfast for 8.30am any later and you had to queue. Key is on a big metal rod and this had to be handed in before you went out. Hotel is well situated just round corner from tube. Just turn left once you come out of tube stationand left at end of street and you will see entrance to hotel. Would stay at this hotel again x

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected. In a good way.”
Reviews.Author: TownDrunk
Reviews.Content: Quick and to the point: This is a 3 star hotel, no more, no less, if you want more go pay more. I think I got what I paid for. With this Hotel you get what you pay for. There are not alot of frills, it is merely a place to rest your head while visting the gorgeous city of London. The staff was friendly and even joked about. The room was clean and small with 2 twin beds. There was nothing in the room except a tv and a phone, no helpful little pamphlets to tell you about the hotel or what channels are what on the tv. Nothing. The room was quiet and I slept well. The location is excellent, walking distance to a tube station and The British Museum (a must see) with other hotels in the area there is lots of shops and restaurants nearby or a short walk away. The continental breakfast can be quite busy in the mornings and has a limited selection, but there is enough there to get you energized up for your dayof seeing the sights or whatever it is you are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with Superbreaks, large, clean, comfortably furnished rooms, staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: holgalleeds
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in other hotels in this area which were expensive DUMPS compared to the Presidents accommodation facilities and location. We were very pleasantly surprised and would def return for another stay. As other reviewers have mentioned, Breakfast can be manic but there is something for all, don't expect silver service, just be glad it is in with the price. Some of our group booked dinner whilst there and thouroughly enjoyed it, others went to the nearby Irish pub at Holiday Inn who do 2 meals for the price of one, approx Â£8 and delicious. [ask directions at reception ] Hope this is helpful, Holl.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dated basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_and_Sharon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we wanted a short break mid week somewhere central in London or near a central tube station which this is as itâ€™s a minute walk from Russel square station. First impressions walking up to the hotel is that it looks very dated and this continues as you enter the hotel foyer. Once checked in we were given a key on a long metal rod as a deterrent to stop you walking out with the key, this had to be handing in whenever leaving the hotel. Bedroom â€“ Small and dated with old metal windows with additional secondary glazing, but this did stop the road noise. The bed felt very hard and seemed old and well used. Included in the room was a TV and tea and coffee facilities. The walls sounded very thin you could hear people talking, moving in their bed and going to the toilet. The cleaning staff had no interest in being quiet and chatted outside the room and were knocking the door from 8am. Bathroom â€“ Fine with bath and powerful over bath shower. Included were shower gels, but no tissues and no hand towels and the bath towels were small, old and hard. Breakfast â€“ Very much a canteen feel about the place, there was a small range of cereals, tea and coffee and juices, but a very good cooked buffet with good English items. Staff paid you very little attention and during breakfast the dirty plates soon built up. All the all we would not stay here again, but if you want it simple and in a good location then this may be fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with good facilities and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DriffTigers18
Reviews.Content: Very warm welcome when arrived just of busy main road about 2 mins from russel square tube. Room was very warm and cosy so this was good as it was freezing outside. room was average facilities but they have everything you expect, we were on 7th floor which had its own lift which was handy. Breakfast was good quality, there was a long que after 8.45 but get there before 8.15 and there's no que at all. when checking out you can leave your suitcase with the porters for the day for a charge of 50p per bag. overall excellent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DandJNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Main plus point for the President is it's location - very near Russel Square underground station, Kings Cross and walking distance of British Museum. Easy walk of about 10 minutes past St Pancras, along Euston Road and down Southampton Row. Located directly on Russel Square. Excellent English breakfast but if you're not down by 8.30 ish, the queue to get into the breakfast room can be very long. This is a very popular hotel with all age groups. A Super Break hotel so well promoted Tired rooms were OK and very very warm. Our room at the back had no view other than the hotel rooms next door. The massive boiler system of that hotel drones on continuously so with an open window to let cool air in could disturb your sleep if a light sleeper. Fortunately I'm not! Sportsman Bar as part of hotel very handy for a night cap. Facilities even include direct access to newsagent and to Barclays Bank. Staff very helpful and friendly. Don't expect more than 2 - 3 star with such as fridge/mini bar, decent toiletries, room information and hairdryer lacking and you'll be OK imho. Would certainly stay here again for typical theatre break/ sight seeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Debtat
Reviews.Content: Arrived very early due to train times, hoped we could drop off luggage but was really pleased when we were actually allowed to check into our room straight away ( it was only 9am) and there was no extra charge. Staff friendly, room was as good as any other we have stayed in. Breakfast was okay, make sure you get down there before 8:30 if poss coz we found this to be the busiest time. We were lucky enough to recieve a free 3 course meal on the evening of our arriva,l which was lovely! No hidden extra's to pay for, unless you had alcohol:-) Would definitely use this hotel or it's sister hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Bog standard hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: TJS1006
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself isn't the best looking from the outside. The reception staff were friendly enough and helpful. The room was absolutely fine - it was clean and warm. The location of the hotel is basically why I would return to it - it's literally a 2 minute walk from Russell Square Tube Station which is one stop from Kings Cross in one direction and a couple of stops in the other for Covent Garden and Leicester Square. We were booked in for Bed & Breakfast but due to huge queues for breakfast decided to give it a miss - there are signs telling you to go around 9.30am but this seemed to be it's busiest time - maybe be better getting there for it opening - or order room service. A good tip for travelling in London is to buy an Oyster card, cost you Â£3.00 - which you can get refunded if you choose to return the card at the end of your trip - but your tube fares are more or less half of what they would be if you were to buy a ticket each time.

Reviews.Title: “Superbreak trip - good value”
Reviews.Author: Rachrelax
Reviews.Content: Hotel i think was great value for money on a cheap break. We arrived at 12.30pm and we thought we would have to wait till 2pm to check in, but they give us our key straight away. the landing to our room were indeed ready for redecorating. The room was a double room and wasnt very big but we were only staying two nights so i suppose it was cosy. The bathroom was little but had a bath and shower, single sink and toilet the room was nicely decorated with a flat screen tv. The room itself was clean but the bathroom was a bit scuffly cleaned i.e round the bottom of the toilet could have been bleached. down stairs was very dark and the bar was like on olds mens club. The breakfast was okay plenty of choice we went down early and we were glad we did as when we were leaving their was a queue out the door. The location of this hotel was great especially when you are using the tube to get around. I felt the staff at the hotel did everything to help you and i experienced no problem within the hotel and the service that we received.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for central London”
Reviews.Author: ss1968
Reviews.Content: Just back from a city break package at this hotel. Given the price and the location ( so close to Russell Square tube / British Museum) I think it is excellent value. The staff were all friendly and very efficient. There was no problem with checking in early and also easy to store our luggage after checking out and before we left London. The room was an adequate size for two and very clean. Breakfast was included and there was plenty of it - again not too bad considering where you are. Is it gourmet? no, but as good as many high street cafes. The President is part of the Imperial group (of which there are quite a few in the area) and is definitely a step up from the National (also on Russell Square) which is larger and tattier.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: JillChrisRobertson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the President Hotel for our honeymoon. We found this hotel to be clean, they staff friendly and the food OK. The room was on the small side but had ample room for our belongings. The room and hotel on the whole were very clean. We were kind of wondering what the hotel would be like after reading some of the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. I would recommend this hotel to couples not looking for the party scene, we just hopped on the tube (very close) if we wanted to go sightseeing or to the pub ect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBluenoser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week, and overall enjoyed our stay. Room was small,clean however I would recommend not getting a room overlooking Russell Square as it was very noisey. Cannot say enough about the hotel staff, friendly and helpful and always cheeful. The breakfast was not the greatest, not much of a selection. Location of hotel is excellent very near the tube station, British Museum and walking distance to lots of sites. However the hotel is very outdated and can definitely use a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: crypticbob
Reviews.Content: Just back from a theatre trip stay had a fantastic time apart from the weather. The hotel staff are friendliest ive ever had and I have travelled/, Room a little small but cleaner than most 4 star ive stayed in inc 4 star. Asked for more towels when just in the room and waited less than 10 mins. The breakfast was good but the buffet is not standard I think but was included in our trip. I'm 5 8 and I fouund the bed a little short, !0 mins travel from Kings Cross or to Harrods via tube. tube staff friendly and helpful much cheaper to travel this way around the town. Russel Sq looked a nice area nice park but the kids were at home and it rained like i said, Very near the British Museum. some nice restaurants pubs and fabulous looking patissirie Valerie a few minutes walk away. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Absoutly fantastic hotel, great location *******”
Reviews.Author: Lis_Geo
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner have just returned from a fantastic 3 night stay at the president hotel, after reading soem reviews we thought oh no what have we booked! When we arrived we were greeted by the members of staff at reception very friendly. Our room was lovely, to me it looked like it had just been refurbished but we told it still had to be done. Was very clean, clean towels plenty tea/coffee etc the bathroom was spotless again plenty soap, toilet roll etc the shower was fantastic (power shower) just what you want after a long day walking the streets of london. Breakfast was lovely plenty of choice a bit slow to serve up tea and coffee but when trying to serve up to a few hundred cant be easy. Location was excellent, minutes walking distance to undergrond. Also tesco just round the corner for any thing you might need. 10 min walk from kingscross if you dont get lost haha like we did. all in all would go back in a minute excellent hotel not a bad word to say about anything. planning our next visit as i type this review haha hope this helped after reading those negative reviews, to me they are just been fussy and would pick faults in a 5 star hotel top marks for the president hotel ******

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: spenceLarkhall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the president for two nights and found the hotel very clean,staff were very helpful and pleasant,rooms were cleaned both days we were there, breakfast was good with plenty to chose from.Right next to the tube so the location was good we walked a lot and it wasn,t long before we were at the centre of london went to see We will rock u. It was superb

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in central London”
Reviews.Author: Plum8
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, 15 mins walk to Oxford Street, Trafalger Square. A great breakfast and pleasant staff. If people complain, then there must be no pleasing them! A brilliant price for the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: montehristo
Reviews.Content: except dirty and decadent all over the hotel : dirty pillows refrigerator-not in room. you can have - only for medical reasons(!!!!) hairdryer and Power Adapter CHARGED 6 pounds each (!) to rent vault in other hotel in next door -really! and much more- but we want to forget them and when I complained - the answer of reception manager was "madam ,this is three star hotel --- what did you expect???? " !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Nota37
Reviews.Content: Been there on the 28th of December for a 4 nights stay.Depressing rooms send you back to 70s with a small double bed and a TV from 80s.Coffee facilities with a an undescribeable mixture of coffee that could not be drunk by all means!In the bathroom one towel ,same for face ,body and hair.Two different tubs, one with hot and one with cold water( that means that either you get burned or freeze! ).No brush at the toilet....and the unmoveable shower thing so high that when water finally reached my 5"4 height I got frozen.No heating in bathroom either and toiletries means soap and shampoo only.Breakfast pathetic (toast,cereal and that strange coffee)Stayed there as a last minutes choice and I would never ever stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “a perfectly fine hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Deepthinker22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were up on London for my husband's birthday. We had read all of the reviews and had come away 'just hoping for the best'. The hotel is fine! Yes it probably could do with some updating and yes guess what the centre of London does get traffic but it is clean, it is in a fantastic location (really close to a tube station and bus stops) and I was glad that we were put into one of the rooms overlooking the noisy road because we also got the fantastic views across Russell Square too. I think it would be a shame if too much were changed though as the hotel does have a lovely charm about it - a good old fashioned reception area - if you want super modern and so brilliantly lit that it hurts your eyes to walk in - go somewhere new and modern. This hotel was warm and cozy and welcoming when you walked in despite it being quite a large hotel. The secondary glazing is not brilliant but as we were here in Winter and the heating was on we had it open anyway as we found the room a little too warm. Sheets and blankets and bed covers are used instead of quilts but ours were spotlessly clean and changed daily and were fine to sleep under. We paid Â£95 per night which I had booked with the hotel itself and that included dinner on the first night and full English breakfast on both mornings. The evening meal at this hotel is a carvery which was good enough for us to book in and pay on the second night (Â£17.75 for three courses but cheaper in the early evening I think). There were four different meats and there had been four different started (including a huge selection of hors d'ouvres) and then seven or eight different desserts with tea or coffee included too. The wine list was not too expensive either. The breakfast was fine too. Fried, scrambled, poached or boiled eggs, sausages, bacon, tinned tomatoes, fresh tomatoes, beans, fruit, cereals, toast, rolls, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and juices. We did not go through to look at the continental breakfast so do not know what that was like. The reception staff, porters, restaurant staff and cleaners were all very friendly and helpful. We were able to leave our bags with the porters after we checked out for 50p per bag for the day (bear in mind this compares to Â£8 per bag at railway stations in the city). In summary I would say that if you want a five star hotel in a quiet area - don't come here. It is a perfectly adequate three star hotel in the heart of a loud noisy city. If you want to be in the city in a hotel that is perfectly fine then I would recommend this one. (the only outright criticism I would have of this hotel is that they were a little mean with towels - just one each but then we did not ask for more so maybe we could have got more if we had done). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “REFURBISHMENT NEEDED FOR THIS OVERPRICED LONDON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FlossWiltshire
Reviews.Content: This was a 30th birthday weekend for our daughter, and was booked in advance-sadly it did not come upto the write-up we had on it, the position of the hotel is brilliant, for the underground and other facilities, but, the hotel itself is definately in need of modernisation and reburbishment, with threadbare furniture in most general areas, still use blankets on the bed, windows did not shut properly, secondary double glazing did not keep out the outside noise at all, or the wind blowing thru.Rooms were kept clean but the general standard of this hotel was 'tired'. Really need to go out to eat and drink but luckily some good places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HillsDundee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the President from 27th to30th Dec, 09. Having read the reviews before we came on our trip we were dreading the hotel. But we can honestly say we couldnt complain about anything, the room and bathroom were spotless. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast were very good with plenty choice, only thing was the toast not brown enough as others have said, but it didnt stop us eating it. Hilary from Dundee.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Superbreak”
Reviews.Author: Suddy
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in The President Hotel in mid-November and had an excellent stay. I was slightly concerned that the reports were sort of 50/50, good and not so good, but either we were lucky (which I doubt!), or some people just do not understand what to expect for their money. Our room was very clean and recently refurbished, the only thing that I agree with, is that the beds are â€œbrick-hardâ€� and they rustle a bit! .....and I like an orthopaedic bed â€¦..but you get accustomed to even that! Oh yes and that key â€¦you would NEVER take that with you, but it makes a reasonable shoe-horn!! Breakfast (full English) was efficient and the buffet selection was always plentiful, and we never encountered any of the queuing mentioned elsewhere. We booked through Thomsons and Superbreak and everything went very smoothly, even the trains were on time! All in all very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars???? We beg to differ!”
Reviews.Author: sunlunlad
Reviews.Content: Whoever rated this fleapit 3 stars very obviously lives in a hovel! Isthis really the best we can expect from this standard of accomodation in 2009? There are so many hotels in London to choose from,please accept our advice and pay alittle more and avoid the stress of atempting to sleep in this chaos. True,the location is convenient,but that applies to many hotels in London. Food,rooms,staff etc all leave much to be desired,we struggled to find anything positive to say. I find it astounding that some reviewers have awarded this place 5 out of 5,they are welcome to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, comfortable but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Leedslass61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President for one night. The location was very good being only a few minutes from the course venue and 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross. The room was comfortable and very clean. Everything worked but a hairdryer would have been useful. The meal in the evening was ok and good value for the price. Restaurant generally clean and staff attentive. Breakfast was fine. I was on the 6th floor and didn't suffer any noise problems. Overall the hotel is quite dingy because it seems to have very little natural light. I used the restaurant for convenience but it doesn't have much in the way of ambience. I think this hotel is fine at the price as a comfortable bed for the night or a few nights but it could do with brightening up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandLichtie
Reviews.Content: having booked through a travel agent on a superbreak , had no idea what hotel was like . looking up tripadvisor found a few reviews saying how bad it was. we found this hotel very clean, helpful staff at desk and restaurant. we were not expecting 5 star accommodation for the price we paid like some ,rooms were well heated , showers good, flatscreen tv, hairdryer and trouser press all in room and overall was happy with our stay. do agree with some reviews that breakfast was only luke warm, feel too much being made at same time then left until eaten. this was at 7.45 in morning not long after opening. this would be my only gripe but was still able to enjoy it. same goes for pre theatre meals at night. good value and food although suggest an early sitting as again food already set out at buffet at 5.30. would go back as wouldnt want a costly hotel when hardly in it due to sightseeing and theatre. excellent location for tubestation to take you into london using piccadilly line( mind to get an oyster card for getting about quickly and cheaper).if 1st time in london like ourselves ,book the big bus sightseeing tour at desk to get around and see all the sights,lasts for 48hrs(hop on hop off) at this time of year and first stop just round corner.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JillCraig
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. It is situated a 3 minute walk from Russell Square tube station. The room was clean and freshly decorated with a very comfortable bed. Small bathroom with good, powerful shower over the bath. Breakfasts were adequate - and no trouble finding a table to sit at. Have stayed at the sister hotel, Royal National Hotel before and personnally I find this hotel to be far superior. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ilias_irini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Excellent location near the tube station, good continental breakfast (have to pay 5 pounds more for English breakfast), cozy & clean rooms.We would go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: spenny66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights andf found the Hotel well located for Tube Station but Noise levels are horrendous at 6 o'clock in the morning!! Vehicles reversing beeps/ Bottle Banks being emptied/ Metal being clashed about/ Trolleys clashing on concrete floors. Made worse by having Single glazing, still loud with the windows shut. Decor is dated, staff not fully conversant with Tube Station locations. Breakfast is a shambles with not enough cutlery being available, food only luke warm, trying to get a hot drink whilst getting past the queue for the hot plate, dirty tablecloths, and the hotel reception, bar and dining room constantly smelling of Kippers! Definitely needs updating and getting some natural light into everywhere, dark and dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: thibodeau
Reviews.Content: The advantage to this hotel is the location..steps from Russell Square Tube station. That's it, that's all. The rooms are dingy, the bathroom shower had brown crusty bits on the ceiling and walls, no shower cap provided. The toiletries consist of multi-purpose shower/shampoo gel in a tiny, tiny bottle and a bar of soap. The toilet wouldn't flush...you had to flush it up to 3 times for it to work. Water from the bathroom sink would back up into the tub - all this black, nasty stuff!! The beds are hard - sheets are very clean. There was absolutely no heat in our room and it was cold - the radiator heater on/off knob had been broken off. The breakfast that comes with the room is awful - and that's being kind. Dried-out, thin white bread barely toasted, very fatty, bacon, eggs - that don't taste like eggs - left floating in water, coffee that is instant - preserves are no-name brand. There is little wait service - you need to set your own table - find your own cuttlery and china, tableclothes are filthy from the previous diner. One guest at our table said if she knew she'd be setting tables, she'd have stayed home! It's also very noisy - room doors are on a spring mechanism that causes them to SLAM shut..so you hear this all day and night! You also hear the busy, busy traffic outside all night long. As a previous writer states, this place is a dump. I initially read all the horrid reviews and spoke with our travel agent to change to the Holiday Inn Kensington Close. Our Agent said not to pay attention to these reviews and recommended this hotel, saying she and her colleagues regularly stay at the President. Clearly, the Agent and her colleagues have very different standards than we do. When I speak with her, she is going to get an earful. Never again will we stay with this group of hotels. Do not be convinced to stay here at any cost...it may be inexpensive, but there's a reason.

Reviews.Title: “awful, awful, awful...”
Reviews.Author: Ralph19
Reviews.Content: Our family had a nightmare stay at this hotel. We arrived on Friday night and my wife and I were to fly home on Monday morning. We had made arrangements for our teenage son to stay in another room at the hotel for two more nights before he flew to another country. Although I had a voucher proving that we had another room booked for Monday, the hotel clerk had paperwork that showed the room booked for Tuesday instead. Rather than change her paperwork to Monday (the hotel was not booked full), we were told that they could not do anything about the situation and that we would have to talk to our booking agent. Try getting a hold of anybody in North America on the weekend, by cell phone. My wife and I did not want to fly home on Monday morning without assurances that our son had accommodations, so we booked and paid for another room for our son. We flew home on Monday and when we arrived, our son called to say that the hotel would not give him a new room until the paperwork with the other booking was sorted out. So in frustration, our son booked a room at another hotel. When you are in a foreign country, you expect your hotel to assist you in every way they can. The President Hotel staff were not helpful at all and despite assuring my wife and I that our son would have a room, they let us completely down. Expedia later told us that there was nothing wrong with our paperwork and that the hotel had made numerous mistakes in the way they had handled things. And the hotel refused to pay for the long distance charges I incurred at the hotel trying to resolve the situation. The hotel was dingy and rundown. The coffee shop downstairs is not ever open. The maids were friendly, but loud. It seemed like they were running the floors they were working on. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Believe me, there are a lot better hotels in this area of London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Percy4
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, to be honest we feared the worst. And on first seeing the hotel I admit it isn't the smartest or most up to date of hotels. However, the hotel was spotless, (although slightly worn in places). Our room was comfortable and clean, (what more do you want at this price in central London?!).
